title: Huneke's Proof of the Friendship Theorem
content: In this section, the friendship theorem ~ friendship is proven by formalizing Huneke's proof, see [Huneke] pp. 1-2. The three claims (see ~ frgrncvvdeq , ~ frgrregorufr and ~ frrusgrord0 ) and additional statements (numbered in the order of their occurence in the paper) in Huneke's proof are cited in the corresponding theorems.

blocks.name: frgrncvvdeqlem1
blocks.content: Lemma 1 for ~ frgrncvvdeq . (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 23-Dec-2017.) (Revised by AV, 8-May-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 12-Feb-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm frgrncvvdeqlem1(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wnel(c0, c1))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cvtx, c3))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cedg, c3))
  -| wceq(c5, co(c3, cnbgr, c0))
  -| wceq(c1, co(c3, cnbgr, c6))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c6, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wne(c0, c6))
  -| wi(w0, wnel(c6, c5))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, cfrgr))
  -| wceq(c7, cmpt(s0, c5, crio(s1, c1, wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c4))))
} = {
  a1ii(wi(w0, wnel(c0, c1)), wceq(c2, cfv(cvtx, c3)))
  a1ii(wi(w0, wnel(c0, c1)), wceq(c4, cfv(cedg, c3)))
  a1ii(wi(w0, wnel(c0, c1)), wi(w0, wcel(c0, c2)))
  a1ii(wi(w0, wnel(c0, c1)), wi(w0, wcel(c6, c2)))
  a1ii(wi(w0, wnel(c0, c1)), wi(w0, wne(c0, c6)))
  a1ii(wi(w0, wnel(c0, c1)), wi(w0, wcel(c3, cfrgr)))
  a1ii(wi(w0, wnel(c0, c1)), wceq(c7, cmpt(s0, c5, crio(s1, c1, wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c4)))))
  sylibr(w0, wnel(c0, c1), wn(wcel(c0, co(c3, cnbgr, c6))))
  sylnibr(w0, wcel(c0, co(c3, cnbgr, c6)), wcel(c6, co(c3, cnbgr, c0)))
  sylib(w0, wn(wcel(c6, co(c3, cnbgr, c0))), wnel(c6, c5))
  xchbinx(wnel(c6, c5), wcel(c6, co(c3, cnbgr, c0)), wcel(c6, c5))
  df-nel(c6, c5)
  eleq2i(c6, c5, co(c3, cnbgr, c0))
  nbgrsym(c0, c3, c6)
  bitri(wnel(c0, c1), wn(wcel(c0, co(c3, cnbgr, c6))), wnel(c0, co(c3, cnbgr, c6)))
  ax-mp(wb(wnel(c0, c1), wnel(c0, co(c3, cnbgr, c6))), wceq(c1, co(c3, cnbgr, c6)))
  neleq2(c1, co(c3, cnbgr, c6), c0)
  df-nel(c0, co(c3, cnbgr, c6))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm frgrncvvdeqlem1(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 → c0 ∉ c1)
  ⊣ c2 =(Vtx ` c3)
  ⊣ c4 =(Edg ` c3)
  ⊣ c5 =(c3[NeighbVtx]c0)
  ⊣ c1 =(c3[NeighbVtx]c6)
  ⊣ (w0 → c0 ∈ c2)
  ⊣ (w0 → c6 ∈ c2)
  ⊣ (w0 → c0 ≠ c6)
  ⊣ (w0 → c6 ∉ c5)
  ⊣ (w0 → c3 ∈ FriendGraph)
  ⊣ c7 =(s0 ∈ c5 ↦ iota(s1 ∈ c1, { s0, s1 } ∈ c4))
} = {
  a1ii((w0 → c0 ∉ c1), c2 =(Vtx ` c3))
  a1ii((w0 → c0 ∉ c1), c4 =(Edg ` c3))
  a1ii((w0 → c0 ∉ c1), (w0 → c0 ∈ c2))
  a1ii((w0 → c0 ∉ c1), (w0 → c6 ∈ c2))
  a1ii((w0 → c0 ∉ c1), (w0 → c0 ≠ c6))
  a1ii((w0 → c0 ∉ c1), (w0 → c3 ∈ FriendGraph))
  a1ii((w0 → c0 ∉ c1), c7 =(s0 ∈ c5 ↦ iota(s1 ∈ c1, { s0, s1 } ∈ c4)))
  sylibr(w0, c0 ∉ c1, ¬ c0 ∈(c3[NeighbVtx]c6))
  sylnibr(w0, c0 ∈(c3[NeighbVtx]c6), c6 ∈(c3[NeighbVtx]c0))
  sylib(w0, ¬ c6 ∈(c3[NeighbVtx]c0), c6 ∉ c5)
  xchbinx(c6 ∉ c5, c6 ∈(c3[NeighbVtx]c0), c6 ∈ c5)
  df-nel(c6, c5)
  eleq2i(c6, c5, (c3[NeighbVtx]c0))
  nbgrsym(c0, c3, c6)
  bitri(c0 ∉ c1, ¬ c0 ∈(c3[NeighbVtx]c6), c0 ∉(c3[NeighbVtx]c6))
  ax-mp((c0 ∉ c1 ↔ c0 ∉(c3[NeighbVtx]c6)), c1 =(c3[NeighbVtx]c6))
  neleq2(c1, (c3[NeighbVtx]c6), c0)
  df-nel(c0, (c3[NeighbVtx]c6))
}

blocks.name: frgrncvvdeqlem2
blocks.content: Lemma 2 for ~ frgrncvvdeq . In a friendship graph, for each neighbor of a vertex there is exactly one neighbor of another vertex so that there is an edge between these two neighbors. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 22-Dec-2017.) (Revised by AV, 10-May-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 12-Feb-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm frgrncvvdeqlem2(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  |- wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wreu(s1, c1, wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c2)))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cvtx, c4))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cedg, c4))
  -| wceq(c0, co(c4, cnbgr, c5))
  -| wceq(c1, co(c4, cnbgr, c6))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c5, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c6, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wne(c5, c6))
  -| wi(w0, wnel(c6, c0))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, cfrgr))
  -| wceq(c7, cmpt(s0, c0, crio(s1, c1, wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c2))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c6)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wreu(s1, c1, wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c2))), wi(w0, wcel(c5, c3)))
  a1ii(wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wreu(s1, c1, wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c2))), wi(w0, wne(c5, c6)))
  a1ii(wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wreu(s1, c1, wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c2))), wceq(c7, cmpt(s0, c0, crio(s1, c1, wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c2)))))
  mpd(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wreu(s1, c1, wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c2)), wreu(s1, c3, wss(cpr(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cpr(cv(s1), c6)), c2)))
  sylc(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wreu(s1, c3, wss(cpr(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cpr(cv(s1), c6)), c2)), wcel(c4, cfrgr), w3a(wcel(cv(s0), c3), wcel(c6, c3), wne(cv(s0), c6)))
  adantr(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(c4, cfrgr))
  3jca(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wcel(cv(s0), c3), wcel(c6, c3), wne(cv(s0), c6))
  imp(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s0), c3))
  syl5bi(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s0), c3), wcel(cv(s0), co(c4, cnbgr, c5)))
  eleq2i(cv(s0), c0, co(c4, cnbgr, c5))
  a1i(w0, wi(wcel(cv(s0), co(c4, cnbgr, c5)), wcel(cv(s0), c3)))
  nbgrisvtx(cv(s0), c4, c5, c3)
  adantr(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(c6, c3))
  imp(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0), wne(cv(s0), c6))
  syl(w0, wi(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wne(cv(s0), c6)), wnel(c6, c0))
  expcom(wnel(c6, c0), wcel(cv(s0), c0), wne(cv(s0), c6))
  elnelne2(cv(s0), c0, c6)
  frcond1(s1, c4, cv(s0), c3, c6, c2)
  adantr(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0), wi(wreu(s1, c3, wss(cpr(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cpr(cv(s1), c6)), c2)), wreu(s1, c1, wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c2))))
  3syl(w0, wi(wreu(s1, c3, wss(cpr(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cpr(cv(s1), c6)), c2)), wreu(s1, c1, wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c2))), wcel(c4, cfrgr), wcel(c4, cusgr))
  frgrusgr(c4)
  3imtr4g(wcel(c4, cusgr), wreu(s1, c3, wss(cpr(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cpr(cv(s1), c6)), c2)), wreu(s1, c1, wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c2)), weu(s1, wa(wcel(cv(s1), c3), wss(cpr(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cpr(cv(s1), c6)), c2))), weu(s1, wa(wcel(cv(s1), c1), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c2))))
  biimpd(wcel(c4, cusgr), weu(s1, wa(wcel(cv(s1), c3), wss(cpr(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cpr(cv(s1), c6)), c2))), weu(s1, wa(wcel(cv(s1), c1), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c2))))
  eubidv(s1, wcel(c4, cusgr), wa(wcel(cv(s1), c3), wss(cpr(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cpr(cv(s1), c6)), c2)), wa(wcel(cv(s1), c1), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c2)))
  bitrd(wcel(c4, cusgr), wa(wcel(cv(s1), c3), wss(cpr(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cpr(cv(s1), c6)), c2)), wa(wcel(cv(s1), c1), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c2)), wa(wcel(cpr(cv(s1), c6), c2), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c2)))
  syl6rbbr(wcel(c4, cusgr), wa(wcel(cv(s1), c3), wss(cpr(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cpr(cv(s1), c6)), c2)), wa(wcel(cpr(cv(s1), c6), c2), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c2)), wa(wcel(cv(s1), c3), wa(wcel(cpr(cv(s1), c6), c2), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c2))))
  pm4.71rd(wcel(c4, cusgr), wa(wcel(cpr(cv(s1), c6), c2), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c2)), wcel(cv(s1), c3))
  adantld(wcel(c4, cusgr), wcel(cpr(cv(s1), c6), c2), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c2), wcel(cv(s1), c3))
  syl(wcel(c4, cusgr), wi(wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c2), wcel(cv(s1), c3)), wcel(c4, cumgr))
  usgrumgr(c4)
  ex(wcel(c4, cumgr), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c2), wcel(cv(s1), c3))
  simprd(wa(wcel(c4, cumgr), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c2)), wcel(cv(s1), c3), wcel(cv(s0), c3))
  umgrpredgv(c4, cv(s0), cv(s1), c2, c3)
  anbi2i(wcel(cv(s1), c3), wss(cpr(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cpr(cv(s1), c6)), c2), wa(wcel(cpr(cv(s1), c6), c2), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c2)))
  bitr3i(wss(cpr(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cpr(cv(s1), c6)), c2), wa(wcel(cpr(cv(s1), c6), c2), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c2)), wa(wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c2), wcel(cpr(cv(s1), c6), c2)))
  prss(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c2, cpr(cv(s1), c6))
  prex(cv(s0), cv(s1))
  prex(cv(s1), c6)
  ancom(wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c2), wcel(cpr(cv(s1), c6), c2))
  anbi1d(wcel(c4, cusgr), wcel(cpr(cv(s1), c6), c2), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c2), wcel(cv(s1), c1))
  syl5rbb(wcel(c4, cusgr), wcel(cpr(cv(s1), c6), c2), wcel(cv(s1), c1), wcel(cv(s1), co(c4, cnbgr, c6)))
  eleq2i(cv(s1), c1, co(c4, cnbgr, c6))
  nbusgreledg(c4, cv(s1), c6, c2)
  df-reu(s1, c3, wss(cpr(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cpr(cv(s1), c6)), c2))
  df-reu(s1, c1, wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c2))
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.wcel.s(s1, c4, cusgr)
  diff.cusgr.s(s1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm frgrncvvdeqlem2(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  ⊢ ((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0)→ ∃!(s1 ∈ c1, { s0, s1 } ∈ c2))
  ⊣ c3 =(Vtx ` c4)
  ⊣ c2 =(Edg ` c4)
  ⊣ c0 =(c4[NeighbVtx]c5)
  ⊣ c1 =(c4[NeighbVtx]c6)
  ⊣ (w0 → c5 ∈ c3)
  ⊣ (w0 → c6 ∈ c3)
  ⊣ (w0 → c5 ≠ c6)
  ⊣ (w0 → c6 ∉ c0)
  ⊣ (w0 → c4 ∈ FriendGraph)
  ⊣ c7 =(s0 ∈ c0 ↦ iota(s1 ∈ c1, { s0, s1 } ∈ c2))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c3)
  ⊣ d(s1, c4)
  ⊣ d(s1, c6)
} = {
  a1ii(((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0)→ ∃!(s1 ∈ c1, { s0, s1 } ∈ c2)), (w0 → c5 ∈ c3))
  a1ii(((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0)→ ∃!(s1 ∈ c1, { s0, s1 } ∈ c2)), (w0 → c5 ≠ c6))
  a1ii(((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0)→ ∃!(s1 ∈ c1, { s0, s1 } ∈ c2)), c7 =(s0 ∈ c0 ↦ iota(s1 ∈ c1, { s0, s1 } ∈ c2)))
  mpd((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0), ∃!(s1 ∈ c1, { s0, s1 } ∈ c2), ∃!(s1 ∈ c3, { { s0, s1 }, { s1, c6 } } ⊆ c2))
  sylc((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0), ∃!(s1 ∈ c3, { { s0, s1 }, { s1, c6 } } ⊆ c2), c4 ∈ FriendGraph, (s0 ∈ c3 ∧ c6 ∈ c3 ∧ s0 ≠ c6))
  adantr(w0, s0 ∈ c0, c4 ∈ FriendGraph)
  3jca((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0), s0 ∈ c3, c6 ∈ c3, s0 ≠ c6)
  imp(w0, s0 ∈ c0, s0 ∈ c3)
  syl5bi(w0, s0 ∈ c0, s0 ∈ c3, s0 ∈(c4[NeighbVtx]c5))
  eleq2i(s0, c0, (c4[NeighbVtx]c5))
  a1i(w0, (s0 ∈(c4[NeighbVtx]c5)→ s0 ∈ c3))
  nbgrisvtx(s0, c4, c5, c3)
  adantr(w0, s0 ∈ c0, c6 ∈ c3)
  imp(w0, s0 ∈ c0, s0 ≠ c6)
  syl(w0, (s0 ∈ c0 → s0 ≠ c6), c6 ∉ c0)
  expcom(c6 ∉ c0, s0 ∈ c0, s0 ≠ c6)
  elnelne2(s0, c0, c6)
  frcond1(s1, c4, s0, c3, c6, c2)
  adantr(w0, s0 ∈ c0, (∃!(s1 ∈ c3, { { s0, s1 }, { s1, c6 } } ⊆ c2)→ ∃!(s1 ∈ c1, { s0, s1 } ∈ c2)))
  3syl(w0, (∃!(s1 ∈ c3, { { s0, s1 }, { s1, c6 } } ⊆ c2)→ ∃!(s1 ∈ c1, { s0, s1 } ∈ c2)), c4 ∈ FriendGraph, c4 ∈ USGraph)
  frgrusgr(c4)
  3imtr4g(c4 ∈ USGraph, ∃!(s1 ∈ c3, { { s0, s1 }, { s1, c6 } } ⊆ c2), ∃!(s1 ∈ c1, { s0, s1 } ∈ c2), ∃!(s1,(s1 ∈ c3 ∧ { { s0, s1 }, { s1, c6 } } ⊆ c2)), ∃!(s1,(s1 ∈ c1 ∧ { s0, s1 } ∈ c2)))
  biimpd(c4 ∈ USGraph, ∃!(s1,(s1 ∈ c3 ∧ { { s0, s1 }, { s1, c6 } } ⊆ c2)), ∃!(s1,(s1 ∈ c1 ∧ { s0, s1 } ∈ c2)))
  eubidv(s1, c4 ∈ USGraph, (s1 ∈ c3 ∧ { { s0, s1 }, { s1, c6 } } ⊆ c2), (s1 ∈ c1 ∧ { s0, s1 } ∈ c2))
  bitrd(c4 ∈ USGraph, (s1 ∈ c3 ∧ { { s0, s1 }, { s1, c6 } } ⊆ c2), (s1 ∈ c1 ∧ { s0, s1 } ∈ c2), ({ s1, c6 } ∈ c2 ∧ { s0, s1 } ∈ c2))
  syl6rbbr(c4 ∈ USGraph, (s1 ∈ c3 ∧ { { s0, s1 }, { s1, c6 } } ⊆ c2), ({ s1, c6 } ∈ c2 ∧ { s0, s1 } ∈ c2), (s1 ∈ c3 ∧({ s1, c6 } ∈ c2 ∧ { s0, s1 } ∈ c2)))
  pm4.71rd(c4 ∈ USGraph, ({ s1, c6 } ∈ c2 ∧ { s0, s1 } ∈ c2), s1 ∈ c3)
  adantld(c4 ∈ USGraph, { s1, c6 } ∈ c2, { s0, s1 } ∈ c2, s1 ∈ c3)
  syl(c4 ∈ USGraph, ({ s0, s1 } ∈ c2 → s1 ∈ c3), c4 ∈ UMGraph)
  usgrumgr(c4)
  ex(c4 ∈ UMGraph, { s0, s1 } ∈ c2, s1 ∈ c3)
  simprd((c4 ∈ UMGraph ∧ { s0, s1 } ∈ c2), s1 ∈ c3, s0 ∈ c3)
  umgrpredgv(c4, s0, s1, c2, c3)
  anbi2i(s1 ∈ c3, { { s0, s1 }, { s1, c6 } } ⊆ c2, ({ s1, c6 } ∈ c2 ∧ { s0, s1 } ∈ c2))
  bitr3i({ { s0, s1 }, { s1, c6 } } ⊆ c2, ({ s1, c6 } ∈ c2 ∧ { s0, s1 } ∈ c2), ({ s0, s1 } ∈ c2 ∧ { s1, c6 } ∈ c2))
  prss({ s0, s1 }, c2, { s1, c6 })
  prex(s0, s1)
  prex(s1, c6)
  ancom({ s0, s1 } ∈ c2, { s1, c6 } ∈ c2)
  anbi1d(c4 ∈ USGraph, { s1, c6 } ∈ c2, { s0, s1 } ∈ c2, s1 ∈ c1)
  syl5rbb(c4 ∈ USGraph, { s1, c6 } ∈ c2, s1 ∈ c1, s1 ∈(c4[NeighbVtx]c6))
  eleq2i(s1, c1, (c4[NeighbVtx]c6))
  nbusgreledg(c4, s1, c6, c2)
  df-reu(s1, c3, { { s0, s1 }, { s1, c6 } } ⊆ c2)
  df-reu(s1, c1, { s0, s1 } ∈ c2)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.wcel.s(s1, c4, cusgr)
  diff.cusgr.s(s1)
}

blocks.name: frgrncvvdeqlem3
blocks.content: Lemma 3 for ~ frgrncvvdeq . The unique neighbor of a vertex (expressed by a restricted iota) is the intersection of the corresponding neighborhoods. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 18-Dec-2017.) (Revised by AV, 10-May-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 12-Feb-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm frgrncvvdeqlem3(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  |- wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wceq(csn(crio(s1, c1, wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c2))), cin(co(c3, cnbgr, cv(s0)), c1)))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cvtx, c3))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cedg, c3))
  -| wceq(c0, co(c3, cnbgr, c5))
  -| wceq(c1, co(c3, cnbgr, c6))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c5, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c6, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wne(c5, c6))
  -| wi(w0, wnel(c6, c0))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, cfrgr))
  -| wceq(c7, cmpt(s0, c0, crio(s1, c1, wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c2))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)

  eqcomd(hs0, iota(s1 ∈ c1, { s0, s1 } ∈ c2), (((c3[NeighbVtx]s0)⋂(c3[NeighbVtx]c6))= { hs0 } ∧(w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0)))

thm frgrncvvdeqlem4(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wf(c0, c1, c2))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cvtx, c4))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cedg, c4))
  -| wceq(c1, co(c4, cnbgr, c6))
  -| wceq(c2, co(c4, cnbgr, c7))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c6, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c7, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wne(c6, c7))
  -| wi(w0, wnel(c7, c1))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, cfrgr))
  -| wceq(c0, cmpt(s0, c1, crio(s1, c2, wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c5))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c5)
  -| diffsc(s1, c7)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(w0, wf(c0, c1, c2)), diffsc(s1, c5))
  fmptd(s0, c0, c1, c2, crio(s1, c2, wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c5)), w0)
  syl(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c1)), wcel(crio(s1, c2, wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c5)), c2), wreu(s1, c2, wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c5)))
  frgrncvvdeqlem2(s0, s1, c1, c2, c5, c3, c4, c6, c7, c0, w0)
  riotacl(s1, c2, wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c5))

thm frgrncvvdeqlem4(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 →(c0 : c1 → c2))
  ⊣ c3 =(Vtx ` c4)
  ⊣ c5 =(Edg ` c4)
  ⊣ c1 =(c4[NeighbVtx]c6)
  ⊣ c2 =(c4[NeighbVtx]c7)
  ⊣ (w0 → c6 ∈ c3)
  ⊣ (w0 → c7 ∈ c3)
  ⊣ (w0 → c6 ≠ c7)
  ⊣ (w0 → c7 ∉ c1)
  ⊣ (w0 → c4 ∈ FriendGraph)
  ⊣ c0 =(s0 ∈ c1 ↦ iota(s1 ∈ c2, { s0, s1 } ∈ c5))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c2)
  ⊣ d(s1, c2)
  ⊣ d(s1, c3)
  ⊣ d(s1, c4)
  ⊣ d(s1, c5)
  ⊣ d(s1, c7)
  ⊣ d(s0, w0)
} = {
  a1ii((w0 →(c0 : c1 → c2)), d(s1, c5))
  fmptd(s0, c0, c1, c2, iota(s1 ∈ c2, { s0, s1 } ∈ c5), w0)
  syl((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c1), iota(s1 ∈ c2, { s0, s1 } ∈ c5)∈ c2, ∃!(s1 ∈ c2, { s0, s1 } ∈ c5))
  frgrncvvdeqlem2(s0, s1, c1, c2, c5, c3, c4, c6, c7, c0, w0)
  riotacl(s1, c2, { s0, s1 } ∈ c5)
}

blocks.content: Lemma 5 for ~ frgrncvvdeq . The mapping of neighbors to neighbors applied on a vertex is the intersection of the corresponding neighborhoods. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 23-Dec-2017.) (Revised by AV, 10-May-2021.)

thm frgrncvvdeqlem5(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  |- wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wceq(csn(cfv(c1, cv(s0))), cin(co(c2, cnbgr, cv(s0)), c3)))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cvtx, c2))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cedg, c2))
  -| wceq(c0, co(c2, cnbgr, c6))
  -| wceq(c3, co(c2, cnbgr, c7))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c6, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c7, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wne(c6, c7))
  -| wi(w0, wnel(c7, c0))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cfrgr))
  -| wceq(c1, cmpt(s0, c0, crio(s1, c3, wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c5))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c5)
  -| diffsc(s1, c7)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wceq(csn(cfv(c1, cv(s0))), cin(co(c2, cnbgr, cv(s0)), c3))), diffsc(s0, c3))
  a1ii(wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wceq(csn(cfv(c1, cv(s0))), cin(co(c2, cnbgr, cv(s0)), c3))), diffsw(s0, w0))
  eqtrd(csn(cfv(c1, cv(s0))), cin(co(c2, cnbgr, cv(s0)), c3), csn(crio(s1, c3, wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c5))), wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)))
  sneqd(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), crio(s1, c3, wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c5)), wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)))
  sylancl(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wceq(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), crio(s1, c3, wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c5))), wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(crio(s1, c3, wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c5)), universe))
  simpr(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0))
  riotaex(s1, c3, wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c5))
  fvmpt2(s0, c0, crio(s1, c3, wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c5)), universe, c1)
  frgrncvvdeqlem3(s0, s1, c0, c3, c5, c2, c4, c6, c7, c1, w0)
}

thm frgrncvvdeqlem5(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  ⊢ ((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0)→ {(c1 ` s0)} =((c2[NeighbVtx]s0)⋂ c3))
  ⊣ c4 =(Vtx ` c2)
  ⊣ c5 =(Edg ` c2)
  ⊣ c0 =(c2[NeighbVtx]c6)
  ⊣ c3 =(c2[NeighbVtx]c7)
  ⊣ (w0 → c6 ∈ c4)
  ⊣ (w0 → c7 ∈ c4)
  ⊣ (w0 → c6 ≠ c7)
  ⊣ (w0 → c7 ∉ c0)
  ⊣ (w0 → c2 ∈ FriendGraph)
  ⊣ c1 =(s0 ∈ c0 ↦ iota(s1 ∈ c3, { s0, s1 } ∈ c5))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c3)
  ⊣ d(s1, c2)
  ⊣ d(s1, c3)
  ⊣ d(s1, c4)
  ⊣ d(s1, c5)
  ⊣ d(s1, c7)
  ⊣ d(s0, w0)
} = {
  a1ii(((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0)→ {(c1 ` s0)} =((c2[NeighbVtx]s0)⋂ c3)), d(s0, c3))
  a1ii(((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0)→ {(c1 ` s0)} =((c2[NeighbVtx]s0)⋂ c3)), d(s0, w0))
  eqtrd({(c1 ` s0)}, ((c2[NeighbVtx]s0)⋂ c3), { iota(s1 ∈ c3, { s0, s1 } ∈ c5)}, (w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0))
  sneqd((c1 ` s0), iota(s1 ∈ c3, { s0, s1 } ∈ c5), (w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0))
  sylancl((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0), (c1 ` s0)= iota(s1 ∈ c3, { s0, s1 } ∈ c5), s0 ∈ c0, iota(s1 ∈ c3, { s0, s1 } ∈ c5)∈ 𝕌)
  simpr(w0, s0 ∈ c0)
  riotaex(s1, c3, { s0, s1 } ∈ c5)
  fvmpt2(s0, c0, iota(s1 ∈ c3, { s0, s1 } ∈ c5), universe, c1)
  frgrncvvdeqlem3(s0, s1, c0, c3, c5, c2, c4, c6, c7, c1, w0)
}

blocks.content: Lemma 6 for ~ frgrncvvdeq . (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 23-Dec-2017.) (Revised by AV, 10-May-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 30-Dec-2021.)

thm frgrncvvdeqlem6(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  |- wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cfv(c1, cv(s0))), c2))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cvtx, c4))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cedg, c4))
  -| wceq(c0, co(c4, cnbgr, c5))
  -| wceq(c6, co(c4, cnbgr, c7))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c5, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c7, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wne(c5, c7))
  -| wi(w0, wnel(c7, c0))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, cfrgr))
  -| wceq(c1, cmpt(s0, c0, crio(s1, c6, wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c2))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c6)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c6)
  -| diffsc(s1, c7)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  mpcom(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cfv(c1, cv(s0))), c2), wceq(csn(cfv(c1, cv(s0))), cin(co(c4, cnbgr, cv(s0)), c6)))
  frgrncvvdeqlem5(s0, s1, c0, c1, c4, c6, c3, c2, c5, c7, w0)
  eqcoms(csn(cfv(c1, cv(s0))), cin(co(c4, cnbgr, cv(s0)), c6), wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cfv(c1, cv(s0))), c2)))
  syl(wceq(cin(co(c4, cnbgr, cv(s0)), c6), csn(cfv(c1, cv(s0)))), wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cfv(c1, cv(s0))), c2)), wa(wcel(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), co(c4, cnbgr, cv(s0))), wcel(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), c6)))
  mpan(wceq(cin(co(c4, cnbgr, cv(s0)), c6), csn(cfv(c1, cv(s0)))), wa(wcel(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), co(c4, cnbgr, cv(s0))), wcel(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), c6)), wcel(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), universe))
  fvex(c1, cv(s0))
  elinsn(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), universe, co(c4, cnbgr, cv(s0)), c6)
  adantr(wcel(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), co(c4, cnbgr, cv(s0))), wcel(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), c6), wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cfv(c1, cv(s0))), c2)))
  com12(wcel(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), co(c4, cnbgr, cv(s0))), wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cfv(c1, cv(s0))), c2))
  adantr(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0), wi(wcel(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), co(c4, cnbgr, cv(s0))), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cfv(c1, cv(s0))), c2)))
  3syl(w0, wi(wcel(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), co(c4, cnbgr, cv(s0))), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cfv(c1, cv(s0))), c2)), wcel(c4, cfrgr), wcel(c4, cusgr))
  frgrusgr(c4)
  biimpd(wcel(c4, cusgr), wcel(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), co(c4, cnbgr, cv(s0))), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cfv(c1, cv(s0))), c2))
  syl6bb(wcel(c4, cusgr), wcel(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), co(c4, cnbgr, cv(s0))), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cfv(c1, cv(s0))), c2), wcel(cpr(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cv(s0)), c2))
  nbusgreledg(c4, cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cv(s0), c2)
  eleq1i(cpr(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cv(s0)), c2, cpr(cv(s0), cfv(c1, cv(s0))))
  prcom(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cv(s0))
}

thm frgrncvvdeqlem6(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  ⊢ ((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0)→ { s0,(c1 ` s0)} ∈ c2)
  ⊣ c3 =(Vtx ` c4)
  ⊣ c2 =(Edg ` c4)
  ⊣ c0 =(c4[NeighbVtx]c5)
  ⊣ c6 =(c4[NeighbVtx]c7)
  ⊣ (w0 → c5 ∈ c3)
  ⊣ (w0 → c7 ∈ c3)
  ⊣ (w0 → c5 ≠ c7)
  ⊣ (w0 → c7 ∉ c0)
  ⊣ (w0 → c4 ∈ FriendGraph)
  ⊣ c1 =(s0 ∈ c0 ↦ iota(s1 ∈ c6, { s0, s1 } ∈ c2))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c6)
  ⊣ d(s1, c2)
  ⊣ d(s1, c3)
  ⊣ d(s1, c4)
  ⊣ d(s1, c6)
  ⊣ d(s1, c7)
  ⊣ d(s0, w0)
} = {
  mpcom((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0), { s0,(c1 ` s0)} ∈ c2, {(c1 ` s0)} =((c4[NeighbVtx]s0)⋂ c6))
  frgrncvvdeqlem5(s0, s1, c0, c1, c4, c6, c3, c2, c5, c7, w0)
  eqcoms({(c1 ` s0)}, ((c4[NeighbVtx]s0)⋂ c6), ((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0)→ { s0,(c1 ` s0)} ∈ c2))
  syl(((c4[NeighbVtx]s0)⋂ c6)= {(c1 ` s0)}, ((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0)→ { s0,(c1 ` s0)} ∈ c2), ((c1 ` s0)∈(c4[NeighbVtx]s0)∧(c1 ` s0)∈ c6))
  mpan(((c4[NeighbVtx]s0)⋂ c6)= {(c1 ` s0)}, ((c1 ` s0)∈(c4[NeighbVtx]s0)∧(c1 ` s0)∈ c6), (c1 ` s0)∈ 𝕌)
  fvex(c1, s0)
  elinsn((c1 ` s0), universe, (c4[NeighbVtx]s0), c6)
  adantr((c1 ` s0)∈(c4[NeighbVtx]s0), (c1 ` s0)∈ c6, ((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0)→ { s0,(c1 ` s0)} ∈ c2))
  com12((c1 ` s0)∈(c4[NeighbVtx]s0), (w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0), { s0,(c1 ` s0)} ∈ c2)
  adantr(w0, s0 ∈ c0, ((c1 ` s0)∈(c4[NeighbVtx]s0)→ { s0,(c1 ` s0)} ∈ c2))
  3syl(w0, ((c1 ` s0)∈(c4[NeighbVtx]s0)→ { s0,(c1 ` s0)} ∈ c2), c4 ∈ FriendGraph, c4 ∈ USGraph)
  frgrusgr(c4)
  biimpd(c4 ∈ USGraph, (c1 ` s0)∈(c4[NeighbVtx]s0), { s0,(c1 ` s0)} ∈ c2)
  syl6bb(c4 ∈ USGraph, (c1 ` s0)∈(c4[NeighbVtx]s0), { s0,(c1 ` s0)} ∈ c2, {(c1 ` s0), s0 } ∈ c2)
  nbusgreledg(c4, (c1 ` s0), s0, c2)
  eleq1i({(c1 ` s0), s0 }, c2, { s0,(c1 ` s0)})
  prcom((c1 ` s0), s0)
}

blocks.name: frgrncvvdeqlem7
blocks.content: Lemma 7 for ~ frgrncvvdeq . This corresponds to statement 1 in [Huneke] p. 1: "This common neighbor cannot be x, as x and y are not adjacent.". This is only an observation, which is not required to proof the friendship theorem. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 23-Dec-2017.) (Revised by AV, 10-May-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm frgrncvvdeqlem7(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wral(s0, c0, wne(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), c2)))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cvtx, c4))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cedg, c4))
  -| wceq(c0, co(c4, cnbgr, c2))
  -| wceq(c6, co(c4, cnbgr, c7))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c7, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wne(c2, c7))
  -| wi(w0, wnel(c7, c0))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, cfrgr))
  -| wceq(c1, cmpt(s0, c0, crio(s1, c6, wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c5))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c6)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c5)
  -| diffsc(s1, c6)
  -| diffsc(s1, c7)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  ralrimiva(s0, c0, w0, wne(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), c2))
  mpcom(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wne(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), c2), wceq(csn(cfv(c1, cv(s0))), cin(co(c4, cnbgr, cv(s0)), c6)))
  frgrncvvdeqlem5(s0, s1, c0, c1, c4, c6, c3, c5, c2, c7, w0)
  mpan2(wceq(csn(cfv(c1, cv(s0))), cin(co(c4, cnbgr, cv(s0)), c6)), wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wne(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), c2)), wcel(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), csn(cfv(c1, cv(s0)))))
  snid(cfv(c1, cv(s0)))
  fvex(c1, cv(s0))
  syl(wa(wceq(csn(cfv(c1, cv(s0))), cin(co(c4, cnbgr, cv(s0)), c6)), wcel(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), csn(cfv(c1, cv(s0))))), wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wne(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), c2)), wcel(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cin(co(c4, cnbgr, cv(s0)), c6)))
  biimpa(wceq(csn(cfv(c1, cv(s0))), cin(co(c4, cnbgr, cv(s0)), c6)), wcel(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), csn(cfv(c1, cv(s0)))), wcel(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cin(co(c4, cnbgr, cv(s0)), c6)))
  eleq2(csn(cfv(c1, cv(s0))), cin(co(c4, cnbgr, cv(s0)), c6), cfv(c1, cv(s0)))
  simplbiim(wcel(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cin(co(c4, cnbgr, cv(s0)), c6)), wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wne(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), c2)), wcel(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), co(c4, cnbgr, cv(s0))), wcel(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), c6))
  elin(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), co(c4, cnbgr, cv(s0)), c6)
  com12(wcel(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), c6), wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wne(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), c2))
  adantr(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0), wi(wcel(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), c6), wne(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), c2)))
  syl(w0, wi(wcel(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), c6), wne(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), c2)), wnel(c2, c6))
  frgrncvvdeqlem1(s0, s1, c2, c6, c3, c4, c5, c0, c7, c1, w0)
  sylbi(wnel(c2, c6), wi(wcel(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), c6), wne(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), c2)), wn(wcel(c2, c6)))
  df-nel(c2, c6)
  nelelne(c2, c6, cfv(c1, cv(s0)))
}

thm frgrncvvdeqlem7(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 → ∀(s0 ∈ c0,(c1 ` s0)≠ c2))
  ⊣ c3 =(Vtx ` c4)
  ⊣ c5 =(Edg ` c4)
  ⊣ c0 =(c4[NeighbVtx]c2)
  ⊣ c6 =(c4[NeighbVtx]c7)
  ⊣ (w0 → c2 ∈ c3)
  ⊣ (w0 → c7 ∈ c3)
  ⊣ (w0 → c2 ≠ c7)
  ⊣ (w0 → c7 ∉ c0)
  ⊣ (w0 → c4 ∈ FriendGraph)
  ⊣ c1 =(s0 ∈ c0 ↦ iota(s1 ∈ c6, { s0, s1 } ∈ c5))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c6)
  ⊣ d(s1, c3)
  ⊣ d(s1, c4)
  ⊣ d(s1, c5)
  ⊣ d(s1, c6)
  ⊣ d(s1, c7)
  ⊣ d(s0, w0)
} = {
  ralrimiva(s0, c0, w0, (c1 ` s0)≠ c2)
  mpcom((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0), (c1 ` s0)≠ c2, {(c1 ` s0)} =((c4[NeighbVtx]s0)⋂ c6))
  frgrncvvdeqlem5(s0, s1, c0, c1, c4, c6, c3, c5, c2, c7, w0)
  mpan2({(c1 ` s0)} =((c4[NeighbVtx]s0)⋂ c6), ((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0)→(c1 ` s0)≠ c2), (c1 ` s0)∈ {(c1 ` s0)})
  snid((c1 ` s0))
  fvex(c1, s0)
  syl(({(c1 ` s0)} =((c4[NeighbVtx]s0)⋂ c6)∧(c1 ` s0)∈ {(c1 ` s0)}), ((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0)→(c1 ` s0)≠ c2), (c1 ` s0)∈((c4[NeighbVtx]s0)⋂ c6))
  biimpa({(c1 ` s0)} =((c4[NeighbVtx]s0)⋂ c6), (c1 ` s0)∈ {(c1 ` s0)}, (c1 ` s0)∈((c4[NeighbVtx]s0)⋂ c6))
  eleq2({(c1 ` s0)}, ((c4[NeighbVtx]s0)⋂ c6), (c1 ` s0))
  simplbiim((c1 ` s0)∈((c4[NeighbVtx]s0)⋂ c6), ((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0)→(c1 ` s0)≠ c2), (c1 ` s0)∈(c4[NeighbVtx]s0), (c1 ` s0)∈ c6)
  elin((c1 ` s0), (c4[NeighbVtx]s0), c6)
  com12((c1 ` s0)∈ c6, (w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0), (c1 ` s0)≠ c2)
  adantr(w0, s0 ∈ c0, ((c1 ` s0)∈ c6 →(c1 ` s0)≠ c2))
  syl(w0, ((c1 ` s0)∈ c6 →(c1 ` s0)≠ c2), c2 ∉ c6)
  frgrncvvdeqlem1(s0, s1, c2, c6, c3, c4, c5, c0, c7, c1, w0)
  sylbi(c2 ∉ c6, ((c1 ` s0)∈ c6 →(c1 ` s0)≠ c2), ¬ c2 ∈ c6)
  df-nel(c2, c6)
  nelelne(c2, c6, (c1 ` s0))
}

blocks.name: frgrncvvdeqlem8
blocks.content: Lemma 8 for ~ frgrncvvdeq . This corresponds to statement 2 in [Huneke] p. 1: "The map is one-to-one since z in N(x) is uniquely determined as the common neighbor of x and a(x)". (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 23-Dec-2017.) (Revised by AV, 10-May-2021.) (Revised by AV, 30-Dec-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm frgrncvvdeqlem8(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wf1(c0, c1, c2))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cvtx, c4))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cedg, c4))
  -| wceq(c1, co(c4, cnbgr, c6))
  -| wceq(c2, co(c4, cnbgr, c7))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c6, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c7, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wne(c6, c7))

blocks.name: frgrncvvdeq
blocks.content: In a friendship graph, two vertices which are not connected by an edge have the same degree. This corresponds to claim 1 in [Huneke] p. 1: "If x,y are elements of (the friendship graph) G and are not adjacent, then they have the same degree (i.e., the same number of adjacent vertices).". (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 19-Dec-2017.) (Revised by AV, 10-May-2021.)

  mpcom(c0 ∈ FriendGraph, (((c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c3 ∈ c2)∧ c1 ≠ c3)→((c4 ` c1)≠(c4 ` c3)→ { c1, c3 } ∈ c5)), ∀(hs1 ∈ c2, ∀(hs0 ∈(c2 \ { hs1 }),(hs0 ∉(c0[NeighbVtx]hs1)→(c4 ` hs1)=(c4 ` hs0)))))

blocks.name: frgrwopreglem5a
blocks.content: If a friendship graph has two vertices with the same degree and two other vertices with different degrees, then there is a 4-cycle in the graph. Alternate version of ~ frgrwopreglem5 without a fixed degree and without using the sets ` A ` and ` B ` . (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 31-Dec-2017.) (Revised by AV, 4-Feb-2022.)

blocks.name: frgrwopreglem1
blocks.content: Lemma 1 for ~ frgrwopreg : the classes ` A ` and ` B ` are sets. The definition of ` A ` and ` B ` corresponds to definition 3 in [Huneke] p. 2: "Let A be the set of all vertices of degree k, let B be the set of all vertices of degree different from k, ..." (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 31-Dec-2017.) (Revised by AV, 10-May-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm frgrwopreglem1(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  |- wa(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c1, universe))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cvtx, c3))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cvtxdg, c3))
  -| wceq(c0, crab(s0, c2, wceq(cfv(c4, cv(s0)), c5)))
  -| wceq(c1, cdif(c2, c0))
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
} = {
  a1ii(wa(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c1, universe)), wceq(c4, cfv(cvtxdg, c3)))
  ax-mp(wa(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c1, universe)), wcel(c2, universe))
  fvexi(c2, cvtx, c3)
  jca(wcel(c2, universe), wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c1, universe))
  syl5eqel(c0, universe, crab(s0, c2, wceq(cfv(c4, cv(s0)), c5)), wcel(c2, universe))
  rabexg(s0, c2, universe, wceq(cfv(c4, cv(s0)), c5))
  syl5eqel(c1, universe, cdif(c2, c0), wcel(c2, universe))
  difexg(c2, universe, c0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm frgrwopreglem1(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ 𝕌 ∧ c1 ∈ 𝕌)
  ⊣ c2 =(Vtx ` c3)
  ⊣ c4 =(VtxDeg ` c3)
  ⊣ c0 = { s0 ∈ c2 |(c4 ` s0)= c5 }
  ⊣ c1 =(c2 \ c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c2)
} = {
  a1ii((c0 ∈ 𝕌 ∧ c1 ∈ 𝕌), c4 =(VtxDeg ` c3))
  ax-mp((c0 ∈ 𝕌 ∧ c1 ∈ 𝕌), c2 ∈ 𝕌)
  fvexi(c2, cvtx, c3)
  jca(c2 ∈ 𝕌, c0 ∈ 𝕌, c1 ∈ 𝕌)
  syl5eqel(c0, universe, { s0 ∈ c2 |(c4 ` s0)= c5 }, c2 ∈ 𝕌)
  rabexg(s0, c2, universe, (c4 ` s0)= c5)
  syl5eqel(c1, universe, (c2 \ c0), c2 ∈ 𝕌)
  difexg(c2, universe, c0)
}

blocks.name: frgrwopreglem2
blocks.content: Lemma 2 for ~ frgrwopreg . If the set ` A ` of vertices of degree ` K ` is not empty in a friendship graph with at least two vertices, then ` K ` must be greater than 1 . This is only an observation, which is not required for the proof the friendship theorem. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 30-Dec-2017.) (Revised by AV, 2-Jan-2022.)

blocks.name: frgrwopreglem4
blocks.content: Lemma 4 for ~ frgrwopreg . In a friendship graph each vertex with degree ` K ` is connected with any vertex with degree other than ` K ` . This corresponds to statement 4 in [Huneke] p. 2: "By the first claim, every vertex in A is adjacent to every vertex in B.". (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 30-Dec-2017.) (Revised by AV, 10-May-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 4-Feb-2022.)

blocks.name: frgrwopregasn
blocks.content: According to statement 5 in [Huneke] p. 2: "If A ... is a singleton, then that singleton is a universal friend". This version of ~ frgrwopreg1 is stricter (claiming that the singleton itself is a universal friend instead of claiming the existence of a universal friend only) and therefore closer to Huneke's statement. This strict variant, however, is not required for the proof of the friendship theorem. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 1-Jan-2018.) (Revised by AV, 4-Feb-2022.)

  a1ii(wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wcel(c1, c2), wceq(c3, csn(c1))), wral(s0, cdif(c2, csn(c1)), wcel(cpr(c1, cv(s0)), c4))), diffsc(s1, c1))

  syl5com(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wa(wcel(c1, c2), wceq(c3, csn(c1))), wral(s0, cdif(c2, csn(c1)), wcel(cpr(c1, cv(s0)), c4)), wral(s0, c6, wral(hs0, c3, wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), c4))))
  frgrwopreglem4(s0, hs0, s1, c0, c6, c3, c4, c2, c5, c7)
  syl5bi(wa(wcel(c1, c2), wceq(c3, csn(c1))), wral(s0, c6, wral(hs0, c3, wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), c4))), wral(s0, cdif(c2, csn(c1)), wcel(cpr(c1, cv(s0)), c4)), wral(hs0, c3, wral(s0, c6, wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), c4))))
  ralcom(s0, hs0, c6, c3, wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), c4))
  sylibd(wa(wcel(c1, c2), wceq(c3, csn(c1))), wral(hs0, c3, wral(s0, c6, wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), c4))), wral(s0, cdif(c2, csn(c1)), wcel(cpr(c1, cv(s0)), c4)), wral(s0, c6, wcel(cpr(c1, cv(s0)), c4)))
  syl(wa(wcel(c1, c2), wceq(c3, csn(c1))), wi(wral(hs0, c3, wral(s0, c6, wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), c4))), wral(s0, c6, wcel(cpr(c1, cv(s0)), c4))), wcel(c1, c3))
  mpbird(wa(wcel(c1, c2), wceq(c3, csn(c1))), wcel(c1, c3), wcel(c1, csn(c1)))
  adantr(wcel(c1, c2), wceq(c3, csn(c1)), wcel(c1, csn(c1)))
  snidg(c1, c2)
  adantl(wcel(c1, c2), wceq(c3, csn(c1)), wb(wcel(c1, c3), wcel(c1, csn(c1))))
  eleq2(c3, csn(c1), c1)
  rspcv(hs0, c1, c3, wral(s0, c6, wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), c4)), wral(s0, c6, wcel(cpr(c1, cv(s0)), c4)))
  ralbidv(s0, c6, wceq(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), c4), wcel(cpr(c1, cv(s0)), c4))
  eleq1d(cpr(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), c4, cpr(c1, cv(s0)), wceq(cv(hs0), c1))
  syl6eq(cpr(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), cpr(c1, cv(s0)), cpr(cv(s0), c1), wceq(cv(hs0), c1))
  preq2(cv(hs0), c1, cv(s0))
  prcom(cv(s0), c1)
  raleqdv(s0, c6, cdif(c2, csn(c1)), wa(wcel(c1, c2), wceq(c3, csn(c1))), wcel(cpr(c1, cv(s0)), c4))
  syl5eq(c6, cdif(c2, csn(c1)), cdif(c2, c3), wa(wcel(c1, c2), wceq(c3, csn(c1))))

thm frgrwopregbsn(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ FriendGraph ∧ c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c3 = { c1 })→ ∀(s0 ∈(c2 \ { c1 }), { c1, s0 } ∈ c4))
  ⊣ c2 =(Vtx ` c0)
  ⊣ c5 =(VtxDeg ` c0)
  ⊣ c6 = { s1 ∈ c2 |(c5 ` s1)= c7 }
  ⊣ c3 =(c2 \ c6)
  ⊣ c4 =(Edg ` c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c2)
  ⊣ d(s0, c3)
  ⊣ d(s0, c6)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c2)
  ⊣ d(s1, c3)
  ⊣ d(s1, c5)
  ⊣ d(s1, c6)
  ⊣ d(s1, c7)
} = {
  a1ii(((c0 ∈ FriendGraph ∧ c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c3 = { c1 })→ ∀(s0 ∈(c2 \ { c1 }), { c1, s0 } ∈ c4)), d(s1, c1))
  3impib(c0 ∈ FriendGraph, c1 ∈ c2, c3 = { c1 }, ∀(s0 ∈(c2 \ { c1 }), { c1, s0 } ∈ c4))
  syl5com(c0 ∈ FriendGraph, (c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c3 = { c1 }), ∀(s0 ∈(c2 \ { c1 }), { c1, s0 } ∈ c4), ∀(s0 ∈ c6, ∀(hs0 ∈ c3, { s0, hs0 } ∈ c4)))
  frgrwopreglem4(s0, hs0, s1, c0, c6, c3, c4, c2, c5, c7)
  syl5bi((c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c3 = { c1 }), ∀(s0 ∈ c6, ∀(hs0 ∈ c3, { s0, hs0 } ∈ c4)), ∀(s0 ∈(c2 \ { c1 }), { c1, s0 } ∈ c4), ∀(hs0 ∈ c3, ∀(s0 ∈ c6, { s0, hs0 } ∈ c4)))
  ralcom(s0, hs0, c6, c3, { s0, hs0 } ∈ c4)
  sylibd((c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c3 = { c1 }), ∀(hs0 ∈ c3, ∀(s0 ∈ c6, { s0, hs0 } ∈ c4)), ∀(s0 ∈(c2 \ { c1 }), { c1, s0 } ∈ c4), ∀(s0 ∈ c6, { c1, s0 } ∈ c4))
  syl((c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c3 = { c1 }), (∀(hs0 ∈ c3, ∀(s0 ∈ c6, { s0, hs0 } ∈ c4))→ ∀(s0 ∈ c6, { c1, s0 } ∈ c4)), c1 ∈ c3)
  mpbird((c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c3 = { c1 }), c1 ∈ c3, c1 ∈ { c1 })
  adantr(c1 ∈ c2, c3 = { c1 }, c1 ∈ { c1 })
  snidg(c1, c2)
  adantl(c1 ∈ c2, c3 = { c1 }, (c1 ∈ c3 ↔ c1 ∈ { c1 }))
  eleq2(c3, { c1 }, c1)
  rspcv(hs0, c1, c3, ∀(s0 ∈ c6, { s0, hs0 } ∈ c4), ∀(s0 ∈ c6, { c1, s0 } ∈ c4))
  ralbidv(s0, c6, hs0 = c1, { s0, hs0 } ∈ c4, { c1, s0 } ∈ c4)
  eleq1d({ s0, hs0 }, c4, { c1, s0 }, hs0 = c1)
  syl6eq({ s0, hs0 }, { c1, s0 }, { s0, c1 }, hs0 = c1)
  preq2(hs0, c1, s0)
  prcom(s0, c1)
  raleqdv(s0, c6, (c2 \ { c1 }), (c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c3 = { c1 }), { c1, s0 } ∈ c4)
  syl5eq(c6, (c2 \ { c1 }), (c2 \ c3), (c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c3 = { c1 }))
  mp2an(c6 =(c2 \ c3), c6 ⊆ c2, c3 =(c2 \ c6))
  ssrab3(s1, c6, c2, (c5 ` s1)= c7)
  ssdifim(c6, c2, c3)
  adantl(c1 ∈ c2, c3 = { c1 }, (c2 \ c3)=(c2 \ { c1 }))
  difeq2(c3, { c1 }, c2)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c6)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.w(∀(s0 ∈ c6, { c1, s0 } ∈ c4))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, hs0, c1)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.cdif.s(s0, c2, { c1 })
  diff.csn.s(s0, c1)
}

blocks.content: According to statement 5 in [Huneke] p. 2: "If A ... is a singleton, then that singleton is a universal friend". (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 1-Jan-2018.) (Proof shortened by AV, 4-Feb-2022.)

thm frgrwopreg1(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wceq(cfv(chash, c1), nat1)), wrex(s0, c2, wral(s1, cdif(c2, csn(cv(s0))), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c3))))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cvtx, c0))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cvtxdg, c0))
  -| wceq(c1, crab(s2, c2, wceq(cfv(c4, cv(s2)), c5)))
  -| wceq(c6, cdif(c2, c1))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cedg, c0))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)

  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)

  -| diffsc(s0, c6)

  -| diffsc(s2, c0)

  -| diffsc(s2, c2)
  -| diffsc(s2, c4)
  -| diffsc(s2, c5)
  -| diffsc(s2, c6)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wceq(cfv(chash, c1), nat1)), wrex(s0, c2, wral(s1, cdif(c2, csn(cv(s0))), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c3)))), diffsc(s0, c3))
  a1ii(wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wceq(cfv(chash, c1), nat1)), wrex(s0, c2, wral(s1, cdif(c2, csn(cv(s0))), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c3)))), diffsc(s0, c6))
  imp(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wceq(cfv(chash, c1), nat1), wrex(s0, c2, wral(s1, cdif(c2, csn(cv(s0))), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c3))))
  syl5bi(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wceq(cfv(chash, c1), nat1), wrex(s0, c2, wral(s1, cdif(c2, csn(cv(s0))), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c3))), wex(s0, wceq(c1, csn(cv(s0)))))
  ax-mp(wb(wceq(cfv(chash, c1), nat1), wex(s0, wceq(c1, csn(cv(s0))))), wcel(c1, universe))
  rabex2(s2, c1, c2, wceq(cfv(c4, cv(s2)), c5))
  fvexi(c2, cvtx, c0)
  hash1snb(s0, c1, universe)
  com12(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wex(s0, wceq(c1, csn(cv(s0)))), wrex(s0, c2, wral(s1, cdif(c2, csn(cv(s0))), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c3))))
  sylbi(wex(s0, wceq(c1, csn(cv(s0)))), wi(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wrex(s0, c2, wral(s1, cdif(c2, csn(cv(s0))), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c3)))), wrex(s0, c1, wceq(c1, csn(cv(s0)))))
  exsnrex(s0, c1)
  syl5com(wrex(s0, c1, wceq(c1, csn(cv(s0)))), wcel(c0, cfrgr), wrex(s0, c2, wral(s1, cdif(c2, csn(cv(s0))), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c3))), wrex(s0, c2, wceq(c1, csn(cv(s0)))))
  ax-mp(wi(wrex(s0, c1, wceq(c1, csn(cv(s0)))), wrex(s0, c2, wceq(c1, csn(cv(s0))))), wss(c1, c2))
  ssrab3(s2, c1, c2, wceq(cfv(c4, cv(s2)), c5))
  ssrexv(s0, c1, c2, wceq(c1, csn(cv(s0))))
  reximdva(s0, c2, wcel(c0, cfrgr), wceq(c1, csn(cv(s0))), wral(s1, cdif(c2, csn(cv(s0))), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c3)))
  3expia(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wcel(cv(s0), c2), wceq(c1, csn(cv(s0))), wral(s1, cdif(c2, csn(cv(s0))), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c3)))

thm frgrwopreg1(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ FriendGraph ∧(# ` c1)= 1)→ ∃(s0 ∈ c2, ∀(s1 ∈(c2 \ { s0 }), { s0, s1 } ∈ c3)))
  ⊣ c2 =(Vtx ` c0)
  ⊣ c4 =(VtxDeg ` c0)
  ⊣ c1 = { s2 ∈ c2 |(c4 ` s2)= c5 }
  ⊣ c6 =(c2 \ c1)
  ⊣ c3 =(Edg ` c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, s2)
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c2)
  ⊣ d(s0, c3)
  ⊣ d(s0, c6)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c2)
  ⊣ d(s1, c6)
  ⊣ d(s2, c0)
  ⊣ d(s2, c1)
  ⊣ d(s2, c2)
  ⊣ d(s2, c4)
  ⊣ d(s2, c5)
  ⊣ d(s2, c6)
} = {
  a1ii(((c0 ∈ FriendGraph ∧(# ` c1)= 1)→ ∃(s0 ∈ c2, ∀(s1 ∈(c2 \ { s0 }), { s0, s1 } ∈ c3))), d(s0, c3))
  a1ii(((c0 ∈ FriendGraph ∧(# ` c1)= 1)→ ∃(s0 ∈ c2, ∀(s1 ∈(c2 \ { s0 }), { s0, s1 } ∈ c3))), d(s0, c6))
  imp(c0 ∈ FriendGraph, (# ` c1)= 1, ∃(s0 ∈ c2, ∀(s1 ∈(c2 \ { s0 }), { s0, s1 } ∈ c3)))
  syl5bi(c0 ∈ FriendGraph, (# ` c1)= 1, ∃(s0 ∈ c2, ∀(s1 ∈(c2 \ { s0 }), { s0, s1 } ∈ c3)), ∃(s0, c1 = { s0 }))
  ax-mp(((# ` c1)= 1 ↔ ∃(s0, c1 = { s0 })), c1 ∈ 𝕌)
  rabex2(s2, c1, c2, (c4 ` s2)= c5)
  fvexi(c2, cvtx, c0)
  hash1snb(s0, c1, universe)
  com12(c0 ∈ FriendGraph, ∃(s0, c1 = { s0 }), ∃(s0 ∈ c2, ∀(s1 ∈(c2 \ { s0 }), { s0, s1 } ∈ c3)))
  sylbi(∃(s0, c1 = { s0 }), (c0 ∈ FriendGraph → ∃(s0 ∈ c2, ∀(s1 ∈(c2 \ { s0 }), { s0, s1 } ∈ c3))), ∃(s0 ∈ c1, c1 = { s0 }))
  exsnrex(s0, c1)
  syl5com(∃(s0 ∈ c1, c1 = { s0 }), c0 ∈ FriendGraph, ∃(s0 ∈ c2, ∀(s1 ∈(c2 \ { s0 }), { s0, s1 } ∈ c3)), ∃(s0 ∈ c2, c1 = { s0 }))
  ax-mp((∃(s0 ∈ c1, c1 = { s0 })→ ∃(s0 ∈ c2, c1 = { s0 })), c1 ⊆ c2)
  ssrab3(s2, c1, c2, (c4 ` s2)= c5)
  ssrexv(s0, c1, c2, c1 = { s0 })
  reximdva(s0, c2, c0 ∈ FriendGraph, c1 = { s0 }, ∀(s1 ∈(c2 \ { s0 }), { s0, s1 } ∈ c3))
  3expia(c0 ∈ FriendGraph, s0 ∈ c2, c1 = { s0 }, ∀(s1 ∈(c2 \ { s0 }), { s0, s1 } ∈ c3))
  frgrwopregasn(s1, s2, c0, s0, c2, c1, c3, c4, c5, c6)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, cfrgr)
  diff.cfrgr.s(s0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.cv.s(s2, s0)
  diffss.ex(s2, s0)
}

thm frgrwopreg2(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wceq(cfv(chash, c1), nat1)), wrex(s0, c2, wral(s1, cdif(c2, csn(cv(s0))), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c3))))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cvtx, c0))

  -| wceq(c5, crab(s2, c2, wceq(cfv(c4, cv(s2)), c6)))

  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cedg, c0))

  -| diffsc(s2, c6)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wceq(cfv(chash, c1), nat1)), wrex(s0, c2, wral(s1, cdif(c2, csn(cv(s0))), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c3)))), diffsc(s0, c3))
  a1ii(wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wceq(cfv(chash, c1), nat1)), wrex(s0, c2, wral(s1, cdif(c2, csn(cv(s0))), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c3)))), diffsc(s0, c5))
  imp(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wceq(cfv(chash, c1), nat1), wrex(s0, c2, wral(s1, cdif(c2, csn(cv(s0))), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c3))))
  syl5bi(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wceq(cfv(chash, c1), nat1), wrex(s0, c2, wral(s1, cdif(c2, csn(cv(s0))), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c3))), wex(s0, wceq(c1, csn(cv(s0)))))

thm frgrwopreg2(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ FriendGraph ∧(# ` c1)= 1)→ ∃(s0 ∈ c2, ∀(s1 ∈(c2 \ { s0 }), { s0, s1 } ∈ c3)))
  ⊣ c2 =(Vtx ` c0)
  ⊣ c4 =(VtxDeg ` c0)
  ⊣ c5 = { s2 ∈ c2 |(c4 ` s2)= c6 }
  ⊣ c1 =(c2 \ c5)
  ⊣ c3 =(Edg ` c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, s2)
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)

  ⊣ d(s0, c1)

  ⊣ d(s2, c4)
  ⊣ d(s2, c5)
  ⊣ d(s2, c6)
} = {
  a1ii(((c0 ∈ FriendGraph ∧(# ` c1)= 1)→ ∃(s0 ∈ c2, ∀(s1 ∈(c2 \ { s0 }), { s0, s1 } ∈ c3))), d(s0, c3))
  a1ii(((c0 ∈ FriendGraph ∧(# ` c1)= 1)→ ∃(s0 ∈ c2, ∀(s1 ∈(c2 \ { s0 }), { s0, s1 } ∈ c3))), d(s0, c5))

  syl5bi(c0 ∈ FriendGraph, (# ` c1)= 1, ∃(s0 ∈ c2, ∀(s1 ∈(c2 \ { s0 }), { s0, s1 } ∈ c3)), ∃(s0, c1 = { s0 }))
  ax-mp(((# ` c1)= 1 ↔ ∃(s0, c1 = { s0 })), c1 ∈ 𝕌)

  exsnrex(s0, c1)
  syl5com(∃(s0 ∈ c1, c1 = { s0 }), c0 ∈ FriendGraph, ∃(s0 ∈ c2, ∀(s1 ∈(c2 \ { s0 }), { s0, s1 } ∈ c3)), ∃(s0 ∈ c2, c1 = { s0 }))
  ax-mp((∃(s0 ∈ c1, c1 = { s0 })→ ∃(s0 ∈ c2, c1 = { s0 })), c1 ⊆ c2)
  eqsstri(c1, c2, (c2 \ c5))
  difss(c2, c5)
  ssrexv(s0, c1, c2, c1 = { s0 })
  reximdva(s0, c2, c0 ∈ FriendGraph, c1 = { s0 }, ∀(s1 ∈(c2 \ { s0 }), { s0, s1 } ∈ c3))

blocks.name: frgrwopreglem5
blocks.content: Lemma 5 for ~ frgrwopreg . If ` A ` as well as ` B ` contain at least two vertices, there is a 4-cycle in a friendship graph. This corresponds to statement 6 in [Huneke] p. 2: "... otherwise, there are two different vertices in A, and they have two common neighbors in B, ...". (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 31-Dec-2017.) (Proof shortened by AV, 5-Feb-2022.)

blocks.content: Alternate direct proof of ~ frgrwopreglem5 , not using ~ frgrwopreglem5a . This proof would be even a little bit shorter than the proof of ~ frgrwopreglem5 without using ~ frgrwopreglem5lem . (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 31-Dec-2017.) (Revised by AV, 3-Jan-2022.) (Proof shortened by AV, 5-Feb-2022.) (New usage is discouraged.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

blocks.name: frgrwopreg
blocks.content: In a friendship graph there are either no vertices ( ` A = (/) ` ) or exactly one vertex ( ` ( # `` A ) = 1 ` ) having degree ` K ` , or all ( ` B = (/) ` ) or all except one vertices ( ` ( # `` B ) = 1 ` ) have degree ` K ` . (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 31-Dec-2017.) (Revised by AV, 10-May-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 3-Jan-2022.)

blocks.content: In a friendship graph there are either no vertices having degree ` K ` , or all vertices have degree ` K ` for any (nonnegative integer) ` K ` , unless there is a universal friend. This corresponds to claim 2 in [Huneke] p. 2: "... all vertices have degree k, unless there is a universal friend." (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 1-Jan-2018.) blocks.name: frgrregorufr
blocks.content: If there is a vertex having degree ` K ` for each (nonnegative integer) ` K ` in a friendship graph, then either all vertices have degree ` K ` or there is a universal friend. This corresponds to claim 2 in [Huneke] p. 2: "Suppose there is a vertex of degree k > 1. ... all vertices have degree k, unless there is a universal friend. ... It follows that G is k-regular, i.e., the degree of every vertex is k". (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 1-Jan-2018.)

blocks.name: frgrregorufrg
blocks.content: If there is a vertex having degree ` k ` for each nonnegative integer ` k ` in a friendship graph, then there is a universal friend. This corresponds to claim 2 in [Huneke] p. 2: "Suppose there is a vertex of degree k > 1. ... all vertices have degree k, unless there is a universal friend. ... It follows that G is k-regular, i.e., the degree of every vertex is k". Variant of ~ frgrregorufr with generalization. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 6-Sep-2018.) (Revised by AV, 26-May-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 12-Jan-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm frgrregorufrg(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wral(s0, cn0, wi(wrex(s1, c1, wceq(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s1)), cv(s0))), wo(wbr(c0, crusgr, cv(s0)), wrex(s2, c1, wral(s3, cdif(c1, csn(cv(s2))), wcel(cpr(cv(s2), cv(s3)), c2)))))))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cvtx, c0))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cedg, c0))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c2)
  -| diffsc(s3, c0)
  -| diffsc(s3, c1)
} = {
  ralrimiva(s0, cn0, wcel(c0, cfrgr), wi(wrex(s1, c1, wceq(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s1)), cv(s0))), wo(wbr(c0, crusgr, cv(s0)), wrex(s2, c1, wral(s3, cdif(c1, csn(cv(s2))), wcel(cpr(cv(s2), cv(s3)), c2))))))
  syld(wa(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wcel(cv(s0), cn0)), wrex(s1, c1, wceq(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s1)), cv(s0))), wo(wbr(c0, crusgr, cv(s0)), wrex(s2, c1, wral(s3, cdif(c1, csn(cv(s2))), wcel(cpr(cv(s2), cv(s3)), c2)))), wo(wral(s2, c1, wceq(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s2)), cv(s0))), wrex(s2, c1, wral(s3, cdif(c1, csn(cv(s2))), wcel(cpr(cv(s2), cv(s3)), c2)))))
  adantr(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wcel(cv(s0), cn0), wi(wrex(s1, c1, wceq(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s1)), cv(s0))), wo(wral(s2, c1, wceq(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s2)), cv(s0))), wrex(s2, c1, wral(s3, cdif(c1, csn(cv(s2))), wcel(cpr(cv(s2), cv(s3)), c2))))))
  frgrregorufr(s1, s2, s3, c0, c1, cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s0), c2)
  orim1d(wa(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wcel(cv(s0), cn0)), wral(s2, c1, wceq(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s2)), cv(s0))), wrex(s2, c1, wral(s3, cdif(c1, csn(cv(s2))), wcel(cpr(cv(s2), cv(s3)), c2))), wbr(c0, crusgr, cv(s0)))
  syl2an(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wcel(cv(s0), cn0), wi(wral(s2, c1, wceq(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s2)), cv(s0))), wbr(c0, crusgr, cv(s0))), wcel(c0, cusgr), wcel(cv(s0), cxnn0))
  frgrusgr(c0)
  nn0xnn0(cv(s0))
  3expia(wcel(c0, cusgr), wcel(cv(s0), cxnn0), wral(s2, c1, wceq(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s2)), cv(s0))), wbr(c0, crusgr, cv(s0)))
  usgreqdrusgr(s2, c0, cv(s0), c1, cfv(cvtxdg, c0))
  eqid(cfv(cvtxdg, c0))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, cfrgr)
  diff.cfrgr.s(s0)
  diff.cfv.s(s1, cvtxdg, c0)
  diff.cvtxdg.s(s1)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)

}

blocks.name: frgr2wwlkeu
blocks.content: For two different vertices in a friendship graph, there is exactly one third vertex being the middle vertex of a (simple) path/walk of length 2 between the two vertices. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 18-Feb-2018.) (Revised by AV, 12-May-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 4-Jan-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm frgr2wwlkeu(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wa(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wne(c1, c3)), wreu(s0, c2, wcel(cs3(c1, cv(s0), c3), co(c1, co(nat2, cwwlksnon, c0), c3))))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cvtx, c0))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
} = {
  mpbird(w3a(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wa(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wne(c1, c3)), wreu(s0, c2, wcel(cs3(c1, cv(s0), c3), co(c1, co(nat2, cwwlksnon, c0), c3))), wreu(s0, c2, wa(wcel(cpr(c1, cv(s0)), cfv(cedg, c0)), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), c3), cfv(cedg, c0)))))
  3impib(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wa(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wne(c1, c3), wreu(s0, c2, wa(wcel(cpr(c1, cv(s0)), cfv(cedg, c0)), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), c3), cfv(cedg, c0)))))
  syl5bir(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wa(wa(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wne(c1, c3)), wreu(s0, c2, wa(wcel(cpr(c1, cv(s0)), cfv(cedg, c0)), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), c3), cfv(cedg, c0)))), w3a(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wne(c1, c3)))
  df-3an(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wne(c1, c3))
  frcond2(s0, c0, c1, c2, c3, cfv(cedg, c0))
  3adant3(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wa(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wne(c1, c3), wb(wreu(s0, c2, wcel(cs3(c1, cv(s0), c3), co(c1, co(nat2, cwwlksnon, c0), c3))), wreu(s0, c2, wa(wcel(cpr(c1, cv(s0)), cfv(cedg, c0)), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), c3), cfv(cedg, c0))))))
  reubidva(s0, c2, wa(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wa(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2))), wcel(cs3(c1, cv(s0), c3), co(c1, co(nat2, cwwlksnon, c0), c3)), wa(wcel(cpr(c1, cv(s0)), cfv(cedg, c0)), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), c3), cfv(cedg, c0))))
  impl(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wa(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wcel(cv(s0), c2), wb(wcel(cs3(c1, cv(s0), c3), co(c1, co(nat2, cwwlksnon, c0), c3)), wa(wcel(cpr(c1, cv(s0)), cfv(cedg, c0)), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), c3), cfv(cedg, c0)))))
  3syl(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wi(wa(wa(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wcel(cv(s0), c2)), wb(wcel(cs3(c1, cv(s0), c3), co(c1, co(nat2, cwwlksnon, c0), c3)), wa(wcel(cpr(c1, cv(s0)), cfv(cedg, c0)), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), c3), cfv(cedg, c0))))), wcel(c0, cusgr), wcel(c0, cumgr))
  frgrusgr(c0)
  usgrumgr(c0)
  syl5bir(wcel(c0, cumgr), wa(wa(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wcel(cv(s0), c2)), wb(wcel(cs3(c1, cv(s0), c3), co(c1, co(nat2, cwwlksnon, c0), c3)), wa(wcel(cpr(c1, cv(s0)), cfv(cedg, c0)), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), c3), cfv(cedg, c0)))), w3a(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(cv(s0), c2), wcel(c3, c2)))
  3anan32(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(cv(s0), c2), wcel(c3, c2))

blocks.name: frgr2wwlkn0
blocks.content: In a friendship graph, there is always a path/walk of length 2 between two different vertices. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 18-Feb-2018.) (Revised by AV, 12-May-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm frgr2wwlkn0(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wa(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wne(c1, c3)), wne(co(c1, co(nat2, cwwlksnon, c0), c3), emptycls))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cvtx, c0))
} = {
  3syl(w3a(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wa(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wne(c1, c3)), wne(co(c1, co(nat2, cwwlksnon, c0), c3), emptycls), wreu(hs0, c2, wcel(cs3(c1, cv(hs0), c3), co(c1, co(nat2, cwwlksnon, c0), c3))), wrex(hs0, c2, wcel(cs3(c1, cv(hs0), c3), co(c1, co(nat2, cwwlksnon, c0), c3))))

thm frgr2wwlkn0(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {

  ⊣ c2 =(Vtx ` c0)
} = {
  3syl((c0 ∈ FriendGraph ∧(c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c3 ∈ c2)∧ c1 ≠ c3), (c1[(2[WWalksNOn]c0)]c3)≠ ∅, ∃!(hs0 ∈ c2, <" c1 . hs0 . c3 "> ∈(c1[(2[WWalksNOn]c0)]c3)), ∃(hs0 ∈ c2, <" c1 . hs0 . c3 "> ∈(c1[(2[WWalksNOn]c0)]c3)))

  ne0i(<" c1 . hs0 . c3 ">, (c1[(2[WWalksNOn]c0)]c3))

blocks.name: frgr2wwlk1
blocks.content: In a friendship graph, there is exactly one walk of length 2 between two different vertices. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 19-Feb-2018.) (Revised by AV, 13-May-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 16-Mar-2022.)

blocks.name: frgr2wsp1
blocks.content: In a friendship graph, there is exactly one simple path of length 2 between two different vertices. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 3-Mar-2018.) (Revised by AV, 13-May-2021.)

blocks.name: frgr2wwlkeqm
blocks.content: If there is a (simple) path of length 2 from one vertex to another vertex and a (simple) path of length 2 from the other vertex back to the first vertex in a friendship graph, then the middle vertex is the same. This is only an observation, which is not required to proof the friendship theorem. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 20-Feb-2018.) (Revised by AV, 13-May-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 7-Jan-2022.)

blocks.name: frgrhash2wsp
blocks.content: The number of simple paths of length 2 is n*(n-1) in a friendship graph with n vertices. This corresponds to the proof of claim 3 in [Huneke] p. 2: "... the paths of length two in G: by assumption there are ( n 2 ) such paths.". However, Huneke counts undirected paths, so obtains the result ( ` ( n _C 2 ) = ( ( n x. ( n - 1 ) ) / 2 ) ` ), whereas we count directed paths, obtaining twice that number. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 6-Mar-2018.) (Revised by AV, 10-Jan-2022.)

  simpr(c0 ∈ FriendGraph, c1 ∈ Fin)
  eqid((c1 \ { hs0 }))
  3ad2ant1((c0 ∈ FriendGraph ∧ c1 ∈ Fin), hs0 ∈ c1, hs1 ∈(c1 \ { hs0 }), (hs0[(2[WSPathsNOn]c0)]hs1)∈ Fin)
  adantl(c0 ∈ FriendGraph, c1 ∈ Fin, (hs0[(2[WSPathsNOn]c0)]hs1)∈ Fin)

  syl3anc((((c0 ∈ FriendGraph ∧ c1 ∈ Fin)∧ hs0 ∈ c1)∧ hs1 ∈(c1 \ { hs0 })), (# `(hs0[(2[WSPathsNOn]c0)]hs1))= 1, c0 ∈ FriendGraph, (hs0 ∈ c1 ∧ hs1 ∈ c1), hs0 ≠ hs1)
  simplll(c0 ∈ FriendGraph, c1 ∈ Fin, hs0 ∈ c1, hs1 ∈(c1 \ { hs0 }))

  ⊣ d(s1, c1)

  ⊣ d(s2, c0)
  ⊣ d(s2, c3)
} = {

  fvmpt(s1, c0, c1, c2, { s2 ∈(2[WSPathsN]c3)|(s2 ` 1)= c0 }, { s2 ∈(2[WSPathsN]c3)|(s2 ` 1)= s1 })

  eqeq2(s1, c0, (s2 ` 1))
  rabex(s2, (2[WSPathsN]c3), (s2 ` 1)= c0)
  ovex(nat2, cwwspthsn, c3)

blocks.name: fusgr2wsp2nb
blocks.content: The set of paths of length 2 with a given vertex in the middle for a finite simple graph is the union of all paths of length 2 from one neighbor to another neighbor of this vertex via this vertex. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 9-Mar-2018.) (Revised by AV, 17-May-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 16-Mar-2022.)

blocks.name: fusgreghash2wspv
blocks.content: According to statement 7 in [Huneke] p. 2: "For each vertex v, there are exactly ( k 2 ) paths with length two having v in the middle, ..." in a finite k-regular graph. For directed simple paths of length 2 represented by length 3 strings, we have again k*(k-1) such paths, see also comment of ~ frgrhash2wsp . (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 10-Mar-2018.) (Revised by AV, 17-May-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 12-Feb-2022.)

blocks.name: fusgreghash2wsp
blocks.content: In a finite k-regular graph with N vertices there are N times "k choose 2" paths with length 2, according to statement 8 in [Huneke] p. 2: "... giving n * ( k 2 ) total paths of length two.", if the direction of traversing the path is not respected. For simple paths of length 2 represented by length 3 strings, however, we have again n*k*(k-1) such paths. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 11-Mar-2018.) (Revised by AV, 19-May-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 12-Jan-2022.)

thm frrusgrord0lem(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wcel(c1, cfn), wne(c1, emptycls)), wral(s0, c1, wceq(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s0)), c2))), w3a(wcel(c2, cc), wcel(cfv(chash, c1), cc), wne(cfv(chash, c1), nat0)))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cvtx, c0))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
} = {
  3jca(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wcel(c1, cfn), wne(c1, emptycls)), wral(s0, c1, wceq(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s0)), c2))), wcel(c2, cc), wcel(cfv(chash, c1), cc), wne(cfv(chash, c1), nat0))
  nn0cnd(c2, wa(w3a(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wcel(c1, cfn), wne(c1, emptycls)), wral(s0, c1, wceq(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s0)), c2))))
  imp(w3a(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wcel(c1, cfn), wne(c1, emptycls)), wral(s0, c1, wceq(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s0)), c2)), wcel(c2, cn0))
  stoic3(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wcel(c1, cfn), wne(c1, emptycls), wi(wral(s0, c1, wceq(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s0)), c2)), wcel(c2, cn0)), wcel(c0, cfusgr))
  sylibr(wa(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wcel(c1, cfn)), wcel(c0, cfusgr), wa(wcel(c0, cusgr), wcel(c1, cfn)))
  anim1i(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wcel(c1, cfn), wcel(c0, cusgr))
  frgrusgr(c0)
  isfusgr(c0, c1)
  fusgrregdegfi(s0, c0, c1, cfv(cvtxdg, c0), c2)
  eqid(cfv(cvtxdg, c0))
  adantr(w3a(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wcel(c1, cfn), wne(c1, emptycls)), wral(s0, c1, wceq(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s0)), c2)), wcel(cfv(chash, c1), cc))
  3ad2ant2(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wcel(c1, cfn), wne(c1, emptycls), wcel(cfv(chash, c1), cc))
  nn0cnd(cfv(chash, c1), wcel(c1, cfn))
  hashcl(c1)
  adantr(w3a(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wcel(c1, cfn), wne(c1, emptycls)), wral(s0, c1, wceq(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s0)), c2)), wne(cfv(chash, c1), nat0))
  3adant1(wcel(c0, cfrgr), wcel(c1, cfn), wne(c1, emptycls), wne(cfv(chash, c1), nat0))
  imp(wcel(c1, cfn), wne(c1, emptycls), wne(cfv(chash, c1), nat0))
  necon3d(c1, emptycls, cfv(chash, c1), nat0, wcel(c1, cfn))
  biimpd(wcel(c1, cfn), wceq(cfv(chash, c1), nat0), wceq(c1, emptycls))
  hasheq0(c1, cfn)
}

  ⊢ (((c0 ∈ FriendGraph ∧ c1 ∈ Fin ∧ c1 ≠ ∅)∧ ∀(s0 ∈ c1,((VtxDeg ` c0)` s0)= c2))→(c2 ∈ ℂ ∧(# ` c1)∈ ℂ ∧(# ` c1)≠ 0))
  ⊣ c1 =(Vtx ` c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c2)
} = {
  3jca(((c0 ∈ FriendGraph ∧ c1 ∈ Fin ∧ c1 ≠ ∅)∧ ∀(s0 ∈ c1,((VtxDeg ` c0)` s0)= c2)), c2 ∈ ℂ, (# ` c1)∈ ℂ, (# ` c1)≠ 0)
  nn0cnd(c2, ((c0 ∈ FriendGraph ∧ c1 ∈ Fin ∧ c1 ≠ ∅)∧ ∀(s0 ∈ c1,((VtxDeg ` c0)` s0)= c2)))
  imp((c0 ∈ FriendGraph ∧ c1 ∈ Fin ∧ c1 ≠ ∅), ∀(s0 ∈ c1,((VtxDeg ` c0)` s0)= c2), c2 ∈ ℕ0)
  stoic3(c0 ∈ FriendGraph, c1 ∈ Fin, c1 ≠ ∅, (∀(s0 ∈ c1,((VtxDeg ` c0)` s0)= c2)→ c2 ∈ ℕ0), c0 ∈ FinUSGraph)
  sylibr((c0 ∈ FriendGraph ∧ c1 ∈ Fin), c0 ∈ FinUSGraph, (c0 ∈ USGraph ∧ c1 ∈ Fin))
  anim1i(c0 ∈ FriendGraph, c1 ∈ Fin, c0 ∈ USGraph)
  frgrusgr(c0)
  isfusgr(c0, c1)
  fusgrregdegfi(s0, c0, c1, (VtxDeg ` c0), c2)
  eqid((VtxDeg ` c0))
  adantr((c0 ∈ FriendGraph ∧ c1 ∈ Fin ∧ c1 ≠ ∅), ∀(s0 ∈ c1,((VtxDeg ` c0)` s0)= c2), (# ` c1)∈ ℂ)
  3ad2ant2(c0 ∈ FriendGraph, c1 ∈ Fin, c1 ≠ ∅, (# ` c1)∈ ℂ)
  nn0cnd((# ` c1), c1 ∈ Fin)
  hashcl(c1)
  adantr((c0 ∈ FriendGraph ∧ c1 ∈ Fin ∧ c1 ≠ ∅), ∀(s0 ∈ c1,((VtxDeg ` c0)` s0)= c2), (# ` c1)≠ 0)
  3adant1(c0 ∈ FriendGraph, c1 ∈ Fin, c1 ≠ ∅, (# ` c1)≠ 0)

  biimpd(c1 ∈ Fin, (# ` c1)= 0, c1 = ∅)

blocks.name: frrusgrord0
blocks.content: If a nonempty finite friendship graph is k-regular, its order is k(k-1)+1. This corresponds to claim 3 in [Huneke] p. 2: "Next we claim that the number n of vertices in G is exactly k(k-1)+1.". (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 11-Mar-2018.) (Revised by AV, 26-May-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 12-Jan-2022.)

blocks.name: frrusgrord
blocks.content: If a nonempty finite friendship graph is k-regular, its order is k(k-1)+1. This corresponds to claim 3 in [Huneke] p. 2: "Next we claim that the number n of vertices in G is exactly k(k-1)+1.". Variant of ~ frrusgrord0 , using the definition ` RegUSGraph ` ( ~ df-rusgr ). (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 25-Aug-2018.) (Revised by AV, 26-May-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 12-Jan-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm frrusgrord(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wne(c0, emptycls)), wi(wa(wcel(c1, cfrgr), wbr(c1, crusgr, c2)), wceq(cfv(chash, c0), co(co(c2, cmul, co(c2, cmin, nat1)), caddc, nat1))))
  -| wceq(c0, cfv(cvtx, c1))
} = {
  impd(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wne(c0, emptycls)), wcel(c1, cfrgr), wbr(c1, crusgr, c2), wceq(cfv(chash, c0), co(co(c2, cmul, co(c2, cmin, nat1)), caddc, nat1)))
  expcom(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wne(c0, emptycls)), wcel(c1, cfrgr), wi(wbr(c1, crusgr, c2), wceq(cfv(chash, c0), co(co(c2, cmul, co(c2, cmin, nat1)), caddc, nat1))))
  3expb(wcel(c1, cfrgr), wcel(c0, cfn), wne(c0, emptycls), wi(wbr(c1, crusgr, c2), wceq(cfv(chash, c0), co(co(c2, cmul, co(c2, cmin, nat1)), caddc, nat1))))
  syl5(w3a(wcel(c1, cfrgr), wcel(c0, cfn), wne(c0, emptycls)), wbr(c1, crusgr, c2), wceq(cfv(chash, c0), co(co(c2, cmul, co(c2, cmin, nat1)), caddc, nat1)), wral(hs0, c0, wceq(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c1), cv(hs0)), c2)))
  simprd(wbr(c1, crusgr, c2), wral(hs0, c0, wceq(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c1), cv(hs0)), c2)), wcel(c2, cxnn0))
  syl(wbr(c1, crusgr, c2), wa(wcel(c2, cxnn0), wral(hs0, c0, wceq(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c1), cv(hs0)), c2))), wbr(c1, crgr, c2))
  rusgrrgr(c1, c2)
  rgrprop(hs0, c1, c2, c0, cfv(cvtxdg, c1))
  eqid(cfv(cvtxdg, c1))
  frrusgrord0(hs0, c1, c0, c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm frrusgrord(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ Fin ∧ c0 ≠ ∅)→((c1 ∈ FriendGraph ∧ c1[RegUSGraph]c2)→(# ` c0)=((c2[×](c2[-]1))[+]1)))
  ⊣ c0 =(Vtx ` c1)
} = {
  impd((c0 ∈ Fin ∧ c0 ≠ ∅), c1 ∈ FriendGraph, c1[RegUSGraph]c2, (# ` c0)=((c2[×](c2[-]1))[+]1))
  expcom((c0 ∈ Fin ∧ c0 ≠ ∅), c1 ∈ FriendGraph, (c1[RegUSGraph]c2 →(# ` c0)=((c2[×](c2[-]1))[+]1)))
  3expb(c1 ∈ FriendGraph, c0 ∈ Fin, c0 ≠ ∅, (c1[RegUSGraph]c2 →(# ` c0)=((c2[×](c2[-]1))[+]1)))
  syl5((c1 ∈ FriendGraph ∧ c0 ∈ Fin ∧ c0 ≠ ∅), c1[RegUSGraph]c2, (# ` c0)=((c2[×](c2[-]1))[+]1), ∀(hs0 ∈ c0,((VtxDeg ` c1)` hs0)= c2))
  simprd(c1[RegUSGraph]c2, ∀(hs0 ∈ c0,((VtxDeg ` c1)` hs0)= c2), c2 ∈ ℕ0*)
  syl(c1[RegUSGraph]c2, (c2 ∈ ℕ0* ∧ ∀(hs0 ∈ c0,((VtxDeg ` c1)` hs0)= c2)), c1[RegGraph]c2)
  rusgrrgr(c1, c2)
  rgrprop(hs0, c1, c2, c0, (VtxDeg ` c1))
  eqid((VtxDeg ` c1))
  frrusgrord0(hs0, c1, c0, c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
}

blocks.name: clwwnrepclwwn
blocks.content: If the initial vertex of a closed walk occurs another time in the walk, the walk starts with a closed walk. Notice that ` 3 <_ N ` is required, because for ` N = 2 ` , ` ( w prefix ( N - 2 ) ) = ( w prefix 0 ) = (/) ` , but ` (/) ` (and anything else) is not a representation of an empty closed walk as word, see ~ clwwlkn0 . (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 15-Sep-2018.) (Revised by AV, 28-May-2021.) (Revised by AV, 30-Oct-2022.)
blocks.origin:

} = {
  syl3anc(w3a(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat3)), wcel(c1, co(c0, cclwwlkn, c2)), wceq(cfv(c1, co(c0, cmin, nat2)), cfv(c1, nat0))), wcel(co(c1, cpfx, co(c0, cmin, nat2)), co(co(c0, cmin, nat2), cclwwlkn, c2)), wa(wcel(co(c0, cmin, nat2), cn), wcel(co(c0, cmin, nat1), cfv(cuz, co(c0, cmin, nat2)))), wcel(c1, co(co(c0, cmin, nat1), cwwlksn, c2)), wceq(cfv(c1, co(c0, cmin, nat2)), cfv(c1, nat0)))

  jca(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat3)), wcel(co(c0, cmin, nat2), cn), wcel(co(c0, cmin, nat1), cfv(cuz, co(c0, cmin, nat2))))
  uz3m2nn(c0)
  sylancl(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat3)), wcel(co(c0, cmin, nat1), cfv(cuz, co(c0, cmin, nat2))), wcel(c0, cz), wcel(nat2, cfv(cuz, nat1)))
  eluzelz(c0, nat3)

  subeluzsub(c0, nat2, nat1)

  clwwlknwwlksn(c1, c0, c2)
  simp3(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat3)), wcel(c1, co(c0, cclwwlkn, c2)), wceq(cfv(c1, co(c0, cmin, nat2)), cfv(c1, nat0)))
  clwwlkinwwlk(co(c0, cmin, nat2), co(c0, cmin, nat1), c1, c2)

blocks.name: 2clwwlk
blocks.content: Value of operation ` C ` , mapping a vertex v and an integer n greater than 1 to the "closed n-walks v(0) ... v(n-2) v(n-1) v(n) from v = v(0) = v(n) with v(n-2) = v" according to definition 6 in [Huneke] p. 2. Such closed walks are "double loops" consisting of a closed (n-2)-walk v = v(0) ... v(n-2) = v and a closed 2-walk v = v(n-2) v(n-1) v(n) = v, see ~ 2clwwlk2clwwlk . ` ( X C N ) ` is called the "set of double loops of length ` N ` on vertex ` X ` " in the following. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 14-Sep-2018.) (Revised by AV, 29-May-2021.) (Revised by AV, 20-Apr-2022.)

blocks.name: 2clwwlk2
blocks.content: The set ` ( X C 2 ) ` of double loops of length 2 on a vertex ` X ` is equal to the set of closed walks with length 2 on ` X ` . Considered as "double loops", the first of the two closed walks/loops is degenerated, i.e., has length 0. (Contributed by AV, 18-Feb-2022.) (Revised by AV, 20-Apr-2022.)

  -| diffss(s0, s2)

blocks.name: 2clwwlkel
blocks.content: Characterization of an element of the value of operation ` C ` , i.e., of a word being a double loop of length ` N ` on vertex ` X ` . (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 24-Sep-2018.) (Revised by AV, 29-May-2021.) (Revised by AV, 20-Apr-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm 2clwwlkel(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cfv(cuz, nat2))), wb(wcel(c3, co(c0, c4, c2)), wa(wcel(c3, co(c0, cfv(cclwwlknon, c5), c2)), wceq(cfv(c3, co(c2, cmin, nat2)), c0))))
  -| wceq(c4, cmpo(s0, s1, c1, cfv(cuz, nat2), crab(s2, co(cv(s0), cfv(cclwwlknon, c5), cv(s1)), wceq(cfv(cv(s2), co(cv(s1), cmin, nat2)), cv(s0)))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c5)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c2)
  -| diffsc(s2, c3)
  -| diffsc(s2, c5)
} = {
  syl6bb(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cfv(cuz, nat2))), wcel(c3, co(c0, c4, c2)), wa(wcel(c3, co(c0, cfv(cclwwlknon, c5), c2)), wceq(cfv(c3, co(c2, cmin, nat2)), c0)), wcel(c3, crab(s2, co(c0, cfv(cclwwlknon, c5), c2), wceq(cfv(cv(s2), co(c2, cmin, nat2)), c0))))
  eleq2d(c3, co(c0, c4, c2), crab(s2, co(c0, cfv(cclwwlknon, c5), c2), wceq(cfv(cv(s2), co(c2, cmin, nat2)), c0)), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cfv(cuz, nat2))))
  2clwwlk(s2, s0, s1, c0, c1, c2, c4, c5)
  elrab(s2, c3, co(c0, cfv(cclwwlknon, c5), c2), wceq(cfv(cv(s2), co(c2, cmin, nat2)), c0), wceq(cfv(c3, co(c2, cmin, nat2)), c0))

  diff.cclwwlknon.s(s2)
  diff.wceq.s(s2, cfv(c3, co(c2, cmin, nat2)), c0)
  diff.cfv.s(s2, c3, co(c2, cmin, nat2))
  diff.co.s(s2, c2, cmin, nat2)

}

  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ c1 ∧ c2 ∈(ℤ≥ ` 2))→(c3 ∈(c0[c4]c2)↔(c3 ∈(c0[(ClWWalksNOn ` c5)]c2)∧(c3 `(c2[-]2))= c0)))
  ⊣ c4 =(s0 ∈ c1, s1 ∈(ℤ≥ ` 2)↦ { s2 ∈(s0[(ClWWalksNOn ` c5)]s1)|(s2 `(s1[-]2))= s0 })
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, s2)
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c2)
  ⊣ d(s0, c5)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c2)
  ⊣ d(s1, c5)
  ⊣ d(s2, c0)
  ⊣ d(s2, c2)
  ⊣ d(s2, c3)
  ⊣ d(s2, c5)
} = {
  syl6bb((c0 ∈ c1 ∧ c2 ∈(ℤ≥ ` 2)), c3 ∈(c0[c4]c2), (c3 ∈(c0[(ClWWalksNOn ` c5)]c2)∧(c3 `(c2[-]2))= c0), c3 ∈ { s2 ∈(c0[(ClWWalksNOn ` c5)]c2)|(s2 `(c2[-]2))= c0 })
  eleq2d(c3, (c0[c4]c2), { s2 ∈(c0[(ClWWalksNOn ` c5)]c2)|(s2 `(c2[-]2))= c0 }, (c0 ∈ c1 ∧ c2 ∈(ℤ≥ ` 2)))
  2clwwlk(s2, s0, s1, c0, c1, c2, c4, c5)
  elrab(s2, c3, (c0[(ClWWalksNOn ` c5)]c2), (s2 `(c2[-]2))= c0, (c3 `(c2[-]2))= c0)
  eqeq1d((s2 `(c2[-]2)), c0, (c3 `(c2[-]2)), s2 = c3)
  fveq1(s2, c3, (c2[-]2))
  diffss.ex(s2, s0)
  diffss.ex(s2, s1)
  diff.co.s(s2, c0, (ClWWalksNOn ` c5), c2)
  diff.cfv.s(s2, cclwwlknon, c5)
  diff.cclwwlknon.s(s2)
  diff.wceq.s(s2, (c3 `(c2[-]2)), c0)
  diff.cfv.s(s2, c3, (c2[-]2))
  diff.co.s(s2, c2, cmin, nat2)
  diff.cmin.s(s2)
  diff.nat2.s(s2)
}

blocks.name: extwwlkfab
blocks.content: The set ` ( X C N ) ` of double loops of length ` N ` on vertex ` X ` can be constructed from the set ` F ` of closed walks on ` X ` with length smaller by 2 than the fixed length by appending a neighbor of the last vertex and afterwards the last vertex (which is the first vertex) itself ("walking forth and back" from the last vertex). ` 3 <_ N ` is required since for ` N = 2 ` : ` F = ( X ( ClWWalksNOn `` G ) 0 ) ` ` = (/) ` (see ~ clwwlk0on0 stating that a closed walk of length 0 is not represented as word), which would result in an empty set on the right hand side, but ` ( X C N ) ` needs not be empty, see ~ 2clwwlk2 . (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 18-Sep-2018.) (Revised by AV, 29-May-2021.) (Revised by AV, 31-Oct-2022.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: extwwlkfabel
blocks.content: Characterization of an element of the set ` ( X C N ) ` , i.e., a double loop of length ` N ` on vertex ` X ` with a construction from the set ` F ` of closed walks on ` X ` with length smaller by 2 than the fixed length by appending a neighbor of the last vertex and afterwards the last vertex (which is the first vertex) itself ("walking forth and back" from the last vertex). (Contributed by AV, 22-Feb-2022.) (Revised by AV, 31-Oct-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm extwwlkfabel(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {

  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cvtx, c0))
  -| wceq(c5, cmpo(s0, s1, c2, cfv(cuz, nat2), crab(s2, co(cv(s0), cfv(cclwwlknon, c0), cv(s1)), wceq(cfv(cv(s2), co(cv(s1), cmin, nat2)), cv(s0)))))
  -| wceq(c6, co(c1, cfv(cclwwlknon, c0), co(c3, cmin, nat2)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c2)
  -| diffsc(s2, c3)
  -| diffsc(s2, c4)
  -| diffsc(s2, c6)
} = {
  syl6bb(w3a(wcel(c0, cusgr), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, cfv(cuz, nat3))), wcel(c4, co(c1, c5, c3)), wa(wcel(c4, co(c3, cclwwlkn, c0)), w3a(wcel(co(c4, cpfx, co(c3, cmin, nat2)), c6), wcel(cfv(c4, co(c3, cmin, nat1)), co(c0, cnbgr, c1)), wceq(cfv(c4, co(c3, cmin, nat2)), c1))), wcel(c4, crab(s2, co(c3, cclwwlkn, c0), w3a(wcel(co(cv(s2), cpfx, co(c3, cmin, nat2)), c6), wcel(cfv(cv(s2), co(c3, cmin, nat1)), co(c0, cnbgr, c1)), wceq(cfv(cv(s2), co(c3, cmin, nat2)), c1)))))

  elrab(s2, c4, co(c3, cclwwlkn, c0), w3a(wcel(co(cv(s2), cpfx, co(c3, cmin, nat2)), c6), wcel(cfv(cv(s2), co(c3, cmin, nat1)), co(c0, cnbgr, c1)), wceq(cfv(cv(s2), co(c3, cmin, nat2)), c1)), w3a(wcel(co(c4, cpfx, co(c3, cmin, nat2)), c6), wcel(cfv(c4, co(c3, cmin, nat1)), co(c0, cnbgr, c1)), wceq(cfv(c4, co(c3, cmin, nat2)), c1)))
  3anbi123d(wceq(cv(s2), c4), wcel(co(cv(s2), cpfx, co(c3, cmin, nat2)), c6), wcel(cfv(cv(s2), co(c3, cmin, nat1)), co(c0, cnbgr, c1)), wceq(cfv(cv(s2), co(c3, cmin, nat2)), c1), wcel(co(c4, cpfx, co(c3, cmin, nat2)), c6), wcel(cfv(c4, co(c3, cmin, nat1)), co(c0, cnbgr, c1)), wceq(cfv(c4, co(c3, cmin, nat2)), c1))

  eqeq1d(cfv(cv(s2), co(c3, cmin, nat2)), c1, cfv(c4, co(c3, cmin, nat2)), wceq(cv(s2), c4))
  fveq1(cv(s2), c4, co(c3, cmin, nat2))
  diffss.ex(s2, s0)
  diffss.ex(s2, s1)
  diff.co.s(s2, c3, cclwwlkn, c0)
  diff.cclwwlkn.s(s2)
  diff.w3a.s(s2, wcel(co(c4, cpfx, co(c3, cmin, nat2)), c6), wcel(cfv(c4, co(c3, cmin, nat1)), co(c0, cnbgr, c1)), wceq(cfv(c4, co(c3, cmin, nat2)), c1))

blocks.name: numclwwlk1lem2foa
blocks.content: Going forth and back from the end of a (closed) walk: ` W ` represents the closed walk p_0, ..., p_(n-2), p_0 = p_(n-2). With ` X ` = p_(n-2) = p_0 and ` Y ` = p_(n-1), ` ( ( W ++ <" X "> ) ++ <" Y "> ) ` represents the closed walk p_0, ..., p_(n-2), p_(n-1), p_n = p_0 which is a double loop of length ` N ` on vertex ` X ` . (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 22-Sep-2018.) (Revised by AV, 29-May-2021.) (Revised by AV, 5-Mar-2022.) (Proof shortened by AV, 2-Nov-2022.)

blocks.name: numclwwlk1lem2f
blocks.content: ` T ` is a function, mapping a double loop of length ` N ` on vertex ` X ` to the ordered pair of the first loop and the successor of ` X ` in the second loop, which must be a neighbor of ` X ` . (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 19-Sep-2018.) (Revised by AV, 29-May-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 23-Feb-2022.) (Revised by AV, 31-Oct-2022.)

blocks.name: numclwwlk1
blocks.content: Statement 9 in [Huneke] p. 2: "If n > 1, then the number of closed n-walks v(0) ... v(n-2) v(n-1) v(n) from v = v(0) = v(n) with v(n-2) = v is kf(n-2)". Since ` G ` is k-regular, the vertex v(n-2) = v has k neighbors v(n-1), so there are k walks from v(n-2) = v to v(n) = v (via each of v's neighbors) completing each of the f(n-2) walks from v=v(0) to v(n-2)=v. This theorem holds even for k=0, but not for n=2, since ` F = (/) ` , but ` ( X C 2 ) ` , the set of closed walks with length 2 on ` X ` , see ~ 2clwwlk2 , needs not be ` (/) ` in this case. This is because of the special definition of ` F ` and the usage of words to represent (closed) walks, and does not contradict Huneke's statement, which would read "the number of closed 2-walks v(0) v(1) v(2) from v = v(0) = v(2) ... is kf(0)", where f(0)=1 is the number of empty closed walks on v, see ~ numclwlk1lem1 . If the general representation of (closed) walk is used, Huneke's statement can be proven even for n = 2, see ~ numclwlk1 . This case, however, is not required to prove the friendship theorem. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 26-Sep-2018.) (Revised by AV, 29-May-2021.) (Revised by AV, 6-Mar-2022.) (Proof shortened by AV, 31-Jul-2022.)

  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
} = {
  mp3an12i(w3a(wcel(c0, cuspgr), wcel(c1, cfv(cvtx, c0)), wcel(c2, cn)), wbr(crab(s0, cfv(cclwlks, c0), wa(wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), c2), wceq(cfv(cfv(c2nd, cv(s0)), nat0), c1))), cen, co(c1, cfv(cclwwlknon, c0), c2)), wcel(crab(s0, cfv(cclwlks, c0), wa(wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), c2), wceq(cfv(cfv(c2nd, cv(s0)), nat0), c1))), universe), wcel(co(c1, cfv(cclwwlknon, c0), c2), universe), wf1o(cmpt(hs0, crab(s0, cfv(cclwlks, c0), wa(wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), c2), wceq(cfv(cfv(c2nd, cv(s0)), nat0), c1))), co(cfv(c2nd, cv(hs0)), cpfx, cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(hs0))))), crab(s0, cfv(cclwlks, c0), wa(wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), c2), wceq(cfv(cfv(c2nd, cv(s0)), nat0), c1))), co(c1, cfv(cclwwlknon, c0), c2)))
  rabex(s0, cfv(cclwlks, c0), wa(wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), c2), wceq(cfv(cfv(c2nd, cv(s0)), nat0), c1)))

blocks.name: dlwwlknondlwlknonen
blocks.content: The sets of the two representations of double loops of a fixed length on a fixed vertex are equinumerous. (Contributed by AV, 30-May-2022.) (Proof shortened by AV, 3-Nov-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm dlwwlknondlwlknonen(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cuspgr), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, cfv(cuz, nat2))), wbr(c4, cen, c5))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cvtx, c0))
  -| wceq(c4, crab(s0, cfv(cclwlks, c0), w3a(wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), c3), wceq(cfv(cfv(c2nd, cv(s0)), nat0), c1), wceq(cfv(cfv(c2nd, cv(s0)), co(c3, cmin, nat2)), c1))))
  -| wceq(c5, crab(s0, co(c1, cfv(cclwwlknon, c0), c3), wceq(cfv(cv(s0), co(c3, cmin, nat2)), c1)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
} = {
  mp3an12i(w3a(wcel(c0, cuspgr), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, cfv(cuz, nat2))), wbr(c4, cen, c5), wcel(c4, universe), wcel(c5, universe), wf1o(cmpt(hs0, c4, co(cfv(c2nd, cv(hs0)), cpfx, cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(hs0))))), c4, c5))
  rabex2(s0, c4, cfv(cclwlks, c0), w3a(wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), c3), wceq(cfv(cfv(c2nd, cv(s0)), nat0), c1), wceq(cfv(cfv(c2nd, cv(s0)), co(c3, cmin, nat2)), c1)))
  fvex(cclwlks, c0)
  rabex2(s0, c5, co(c1, cfv(cclwwlknon, c0), c3), wceq(cfv(cv(s0), co(c3, cmin, nat2)), c1))
  ovex(c1, cfv(cclwwlknon, c0), c3)
  dlwwlknondlwlknonf1o(s0, hs0, c0, c1, c2, c3, cmpt(hs0, c4, co(cfv(c2nd, cv(hs0)), cpfx, cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(hs0))))), c4, c5)
  eqid(cmpt(hs0, c4, co(cfv(c2nd, cv(hs0)), cpfx, cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(hs0))))))
  f1oen2g(c4, universe, c5, universe, cmpt(hs0, c4, co(cfv(c2nd, cv(hs0)), cpfx, cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(hs0))))))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, cclwlks, c0)
  diff.cclwlks.s(s0)
  diff.co.s(s0, c1, cfv(cclwwlknon, c0), c3)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, cclwwlknon, c0)
  diff.cclwwlknon.s(s0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c4)
}

  ovex(c1, (ClWWalksNOn ` c0), c3)

blocks.name: wlkl0
blocks.content: There is exactly one walk of length 0 on each vertex ` X ` . (Contributed by AV, 4-Jun-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm wlkl0(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(crab(s0, cfv(cclwlks, c2), wa(wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), nat0), wceq(cfv(cfv(c2nd, cv(s0)), nat0), c0))), csn(cop(emptycls, csn(cop(nat0, c0))))))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cvtx, c2))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(crab(s0, cfv(cclwlks, c2), wa(wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), nat0), wceq(cfv(cfv(c2nd, cv(s0)), nat0), c0))), csn(cop(emptycls, csn(cop(nat0, c0)))))), diffsc(s0, c2))
  sylibr(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(crab(s0, cfv(cclwlks, c2), wa(wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), nat0), wceq(cfv(cfv(c2nd, cv(s0)), nat0), c0))), csn(cop(emptycls, csn(cop(nat0, c0))))), wal(s0, wb(wa(wcel(cv(s0), cfv(cclwlks, c2)), wa(wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), nat0), wceq(cfv(cfv(c2nd, cv(s0)), nat0), c0))), wceq(cv(s0), cop(emptycls, csn(cop(nat0, c0)))))))

blocks.name: clwlknon2num
blocks.content: There are k walks of length 2 on each vertex ` X ` in a k-regular simple graph. Variant of ~ clwwlknon2num , using the general definition of walks instead of walks as words. (Contributed by AV, 4-Jun-2022.)

blocks.content: Lemma 1 for ~ numclwlk1 (Statement 9 in [Huneke] p. 2 for n=2): "the number of closed 2-walks v(0) v(1) v(2) from v = v(0) = v(2) ... is kf(0)". (Contributed by AV, 23-May-2022.)

blocks.name: numclwlk1lem2
blocks.content: Lemma 2 for ~ numclwlk1 (Statement 9 in [Huneke] p. 2 for n>2). This theorem corresponds to ~ numclwwlk1 , using the general definition of walks instead of walks as words. (Contributed by AV, 4-Jun-2022.)

blocks.name: numclwlk1
blocks.content: Statement 9 in [Huneke] p. 2: "If n > 1, then the number of closed n-walks v(0) ... v(n-2) v(n-1) v(n) from v = v(0) = v(n) with v(n-2) = v is kf(n-2)". Since ` G ` is k-regular, the vertex v(n-2) = v has k neighbors v(n-1), so there are k walks from v(n-2) = v to v(n) = v (via each of v's neighbors) completing each of the f(n-2) walks from v=v(0) to v(n-2)=v. This theorem holds even for k=0. (Contributed by AV, 23-May-2022.)
blocks.origin:

  -| wceq(c0, cfv(cvtx, c1))
  -| wceq(c5, crab(s0, cfv(cclwlks, c1), w3a(wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), c4), wceq(cfv(cfv(c2nd, cv(s0)), nat0), c3), wceq(cfv(cfv(c2nd, cv(s0)), co(c4, cmin, nat2)), c3))))
  -| wceq(c6, crab(s0, cfv(cclwlks, c1), wa(wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), co(c4, cmin, nat2)), wceq(cfv(cfv(c2nd, cv(s0)), nat0), c3))))

  -| diffsc(s0, c6)
} = {
  impcom(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wbr(c1, crusgr, c2)), wa(wcel(c3, c0), wcel(c4, cfv(cuz, nat2))), wceq(cfv(chash, c5), co(c2, cmul, cfv(chash, c6))))
  impcom(wcel(c3, c0), wcel(c4, cfv(cuz, nat2)), wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wbr(c1, crusgr, c2)), wceq(cfv(chash, c5), co(c2, cmul, cfv(chash, c6)))))

  expcom(wa(wcel(c3, c0), wceq(c4, nat2)), wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wbr(c1, crusgr, c2)), wceq(cfv(chash, c5), co(c2, cmul, cfv(chash, c6))))
  numclwlk1lem1(s0, c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, c5, c6)

blocks.name: numclwwlkovq
blocks.content: Value of operation ` Q ` , mapping a vertex ` v ` and a positive integer ` n ` to the not closed walks v(0) ... v(n) of length ` n ` from a fixed vertex ` v ` = v(0). "Not closed" means v(n) =/= v(0). Remark: ` n e. NN0 ` would not be useful: ~ numclwwlkqhash would not hold, because ` ( K ^ 0 ) = 1 ` ! (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 27-Sep-2018.) (Revised by AV, 30-May-2021.)

blocks.name: numclwwlkqhash
blocks.content: In a ` K `-regular graph, the size of the set of walks of length ` N ` starting with a fixed vertex ` X ` and ending not at this vertex is the difference between ` K ` to the power of ` N ` and the size of the set of closed walks of length ` N ` on vertex ` X ` . (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 30-Sep-2018.) (Revised by AV, 30-May-2021.) (Revised by AV, 5-Mar-2022.) (Proof shortened by AV, 7-Jul-2022.)

  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cvtx, c0))
  -| wceq(c5, cmpo(s0, s1, c2, cn, crab(s2, co(cv(s1), cwwlksn, c0), wa(wceq(cfv(cv(s2), nat0), cv(s0)), wne(cfv(clsw, cv(s2)), cv(s0))))))

  -| diffsc(s2, c4)
